description:
After coming into the store multiple times just to score free caramel squares, my boyfriend and I thought it was finally time to try out one of their signature sundaes. We split the Cookie Bits Sundae, which comes with vanilla and cookies 'n cream ice cream (my favorite ice cream), handmade hot fudge, whipped cream, Ghirardelli Chocolate Chip Cookie crumbles and two Ghirardelli Milk Chocolate Caramel minis. I do not know how else to describe the sundae except for that it was decadent and wonderful - oftentimes the simplest ingredients are the best. The ice cream is rich and creamy, the hot fudge is made from their own chocolates (no artificial aftertaste), the chocolate chip cookie crumbles provide a delightful crunch, and the milk chocolate caramel minis add a burst of flavor. We finished the entire sundae in one sitting, even though I'm pretty sure it was meant for 4+ people to split! Service is prompt, and we only waited 5-10 minutes for our sundae to come out.

 Unfortunately, as it is located at the heart of the city, it's not as charming as the Ghirardelli Square location is, and there are constantly people entering and exiting the store simply to browse. If you are a tourist in SF for the first time and want to get the truest, most authentic Ghirardelli experience, I would recommend making the trek to Ghirardelli Square near the Embarcadero. I also visited Ghirardelli Square during my summer in SF, and the ambience & ocean views are incredible. Especially because there is an outdoor seating area / patio, Ghirardelli Square is the best place to share an ice cream on a sunny day!
author: Claire L.

description:
Overall just....ok.

Came here for a post dinner sundae and the sundaes are not cheap ($10-$13), but it had generous amount of ice cream and the trademark Ghirardelli fudge!

My only complaint is there is no way an average person could finish one, leaving a lot to waste. Come here with intent to share else you'll just feel bad afterwards :)

Fudge was good but could be warmer, the ice cream wasn't outstanding but wasn't bad - I'd come back to try and share a sundae but for one person it was way too much!
author: Alvin H.

description:
Pretty good sundae! Chrissy sundae. It has generous amount of cookies. I love it! Very tasty. 

Also, it's huge. So it takes about 4 people to eat this.
author: Rose F.

description: I am not a huge fan on chocolate with soy in it but the aroma of waffle batter in the iron drew me in. I looked around for a bit then decided I wanted to get a single scoop of cookies n' cream in a fresh waffle cone and I surprised with how good it was. Price wasn't too bad at $5.75 I just don't care for the part of town that it is in. Very nostalgic feel to the place and there is some awesome bar seating that looks out to the streets.
author: John C.

description:
It's hard to beat a sundae and some chocolate at Ghirardelli. It's the classic ice cream sundae that everybody loves. If you don't like it, there's something wrong with you. Mentally. Wrong. 

My wife and I shared a sundae with brownie. For me, being a savory person, just a couple bites on sweets and I was good. 

The biggest knock on this location is there aren't enough seats available to all the customers. This location is just too small for the amount of people. The location in Fisherman's Wharf area is 100% times better and I want to say the sundaes areeven a tad better in the big location.

But overall for a good chocolate fix, this location does the job.
author: Michael L.

description: This ooey, gooey, decadent, sinful amazing brownie vanilla sundae (Treasure Island) hit the spot after dinner at Plouf. I'm not usually a fan of fudge overload but this homemade fudge was so good.  I want it again right now.
author: Rachel M.

description:
Stayed at the Palace Hotel for 4 nights and we went to this place 3 times! Loved the Decadent Chocolate drink, Butter Pecan and Cookie Dough Ice Cream.

We bought lots of chocolates to bring back home too!
author: Benjamin S.

description: We usually come here for our after dinner hot chocolate...  my kids love it. Very hot and very cholately.
author: Ann C.

description: Stopped by on Sunday night for some dessert: my friends each had a chocolate and vanilla (large) shake, and I opted for the raspberry sorbet with fudge! For someone who does NOT like chocolate at all, the fudge was really good because it was kind of ooey and gooey and had the best texture with the icy sorbet! It's definitely a splurge to come here, so if you're coming, be sure to sit down and enjoy the ambiance!
author: Sherry W.

description: Expresso chip ice cream on a waffle cone - doneperfect cold and hot coffee, smoothies, and best of all ice cream and chocolate. I wanted to try the new Cookie Crisp sundae but I knew it would be too much so I opted for a single scoop instead.it was just enough, huge portions.
author: Ruby A.

description:
After 8 miles of roaming around the city, my feet needed a break and I was looking for something sweet. I had come to Ghirardelli square often as a child for ice cream and I was curious to see if it was still as amazing as I remembered. 

They had cute patio seating outside which is great for gazing out at the water. The inside of the store is small ( note: if you want to go to the main one, it's up the stairs and crazy busy) but still full of goodies! The only menus they have for their ice cream sundae deals is at the entrance so don't miss it! 

I ordered an Oreo shake and it took about 5-7 minutes to make, despite me being the only one in the store at the time. It was good. Not great, just good. I think the employees are probably over the tourists asking if that location is the main one, where the bathrooms are, etc because they were a bit short on patience. 

I would say if you're looking to rest your feet somewhere with a view and want to avoid mega crowds, come to this location! Otherwise, if you want the more traditional experience walk upstairs!
author: Steph G.

description:
Stopped here on Sunday afternoon after some shopping on Market st. It was a good busy - enough to keep the place buzzing, but not too many people/tourists to where it affects the service. I split the paint ladies espresso dessert with my boyfriend, and it was more than enough sugar for us.

It's a fun, clean, quiet place to stop for a bit. Lots of seating inside, mostly tourists. Prices feel SF-ish. You get a free piece of Ghirardelli chocolate upon entering. It's always been caramel (least fav) when I go, unfortunately.
author: Thu P.

description:
I walk pass Ghirardelli every day on my way into the office and would see people enjoying their ice cream sundaes. I finally caved in and decided to have one for myself. 

I generally like Ghirardelli chocolate so I imagined that ice cream topped with high quality chocolate would be amazing. It was. The only bad thing was that my order was inadvertently made to go, so I had to eat it out of a plastic cup. This made it hard to eat. Bleh. 

I would not recommend taking their sundaes to go since they're meant to be enjoyed right away. Also, The hot fudge melts the ice cream which makes for a sloppy mess.  

Aside from the ice cream there are tons of chocolates to choose from here.
author: Simon S.

description: Delicious brownies! I ordered the banana split and it was delicious. I added extra brownies which made it great. The best brownies ever. My only concern is that the little plate they put the banana split in was way too small. I ended up making a mess and dropping everything on the table. It was way too messy which I didn't like but delicious!
author: Andrea C.

description:
Popular tourist destination per it's location and proximity to mass transit. 

While I like the ice cream here I just think there are better more innovate options nearby and throughout the city. Throw in the price point for this location and that's why I give it a 2 star rating. I've been here several times but recently I snagged a mint chocolate chip and it was pretty good. 

So many good ice cream/gelato/chocolate spots in the city. Here is my ranking but they are all pretty darn good.

Who doesn't love Chocolate and Ice Cream? (If you're raising your hand you can stop here )

author: Rod M.

description:
YELP 100 CHALLENGE 2018 - 94/100. 

Coming from SFMOMA, Hubbers had a taste for some kind of dessert. There wasn't really a lot of places open around the area -  much less for dessert - especially on a Sunday. It wasn't really a big deal, "not important." 

But right before heading down Montgomery to catch the Bart, there it was: GHIRARDELLI. 

It was meant to be! It couldn't have been more perfect! 

Walked in and whoa! Pretty packed! And a greeter gave us each a sample. 

Hubbers got an ocean beach. Since there was a chill outside, I went for the sea salt caramel hot cocoa. Both got to our table in no time. (They really didn't mess around!) 

Not a fan of dessert or sweets, but the sea salt was a great way to level the sweetness down on the hot cocoa. Hubbers liked his treat! We liked the stop so much, we ended up buying and bringing home more chocolates! (Mostly for him, though...)

It was a great discovery and a great stop. Will keep a mental note of that location for the next time we're around here and Hubbers needs his sugar fix!
author: Jennifer B.

description: Located on Market and New Montgomery street. Bart station near by! Been here a few times now and still get the same great smiling people! Love the fact that this is my first stop once off the Bart train! Awesome sundaes and hot chocolate especially the sea salt hot cocoa. Hot and sweet! This spot is always busy. Great for a short stop if meeting with friends. Love their chocolates so I don't not ever come in here when I'm in the area.
author: Jemellee S.

description: Fuck the fats and sugar. I'm absolutely sweetlover and sugar fan!  When I come here I'm ready to sell my soul to the Diablo ==)) they make such a yummy ice cream and stuff with different tastes. Come here, try it and bring your kids in. They will name you as a Hero))
author: Vadim R.

description: Sugar rush !!! Place is really great for Sunday's. Definitely in the mood for chocolate this is the place to go. Be careful, the portions are bigger than expected. It might be a good idea to share. We were walking through market street and made a good decision stopping here
author: Aaron V.

description:
I love the holidays. Why? Cuz someone will always bring me peppermint bark. Luckily, we got a bag at work on Tuesday, December 19th around 12:15pm. It contained both dark chocolate and regular, so I was happy as I adore the dark chocolate ones. I love the minty peppermint.

Not sure if they sell peppermint bark all year round, but I look forward to the holidays because of it. Sure, they have other delicious squares, but being a fan of peppermint ice cream, I'll always have a place in my heart for the dark chocolate peppermint squares. So decadent, refreshing, and comforting.
author: Elena N.

description: It's a Ghirardelli store. I like coming in to get sample squares of chocolate, but I think it's also worth ordering one of their frighteningly unhealthy sundaes at some point in your life (shared with friends, of course). The Earthquake is a monster, but if you want an even higher calorie/dollar ratio, get the brownie one. Best brownie I've ever had.
author: Serena J.

description: Love it every time. It's always clean, staff is friendly, and ice cream is great. Only thing is their brownie on the Sunday is not always warmed up.
author: Arjan N.

description: Ghirardelli ice cream is good but doesn't compare with Fenton's (Piedmont). I got the banana split. Seemed like it was half whipped cream. For roughly the same price as a Banana Jr (smaller version of Fenton's Banana special) at Fenton's, you get roughly less than 1/2 the amount of ice cream (3 mini scoops of vanilla, strawberry and chocolate). They also skimped on the pineapple and strawberry sauce. Ghirardelli banana split not a good value. Should have gotten the classic fudge sundae. Also, not huge but think get more ice cream. Lot's of tourists, so place was busy.
author: Ronald C.

description: The place is always full of people. Was curious to try one of their sundaes. Ordered Crissy field sundae which is quite good and would take two people to finish it. The price was around 13-14 dollars which was reasonable. Would come here again on a sunday to try another sundae.
author: Sharad B.

description: Denied my $1.00 off coupon because the sundae I ordered wasn't a qualifying sundae despite the coupon saying "any sundae" and the cashier saying she could apply the coupon.  Her annoying attitude is reason enough to avoid this overpriced tourist trap.
author: Jamey E.

description:
This is definitely a place you have to go to once in your life - especially when you're feeling touristy and want to go to the original Ghirardelli.

However, that being said, there could be better. For once, the workers were not the nicest, and seemed like they were just waiting for time to pass. Giving them the benefit of the doubt, it does get really busy it there, however they need to work on their customer service. The desserts are way too overpriced too, especially for the simple things like the banana split which is $13 and basically like any banana split you can get.

I got the Ocean Beach which was amazing. The salted caramel tasted really good and the chocolate was really rich. 

If you go here and don't want to be disappointed, get any of the hot fudge sundaes. Other than that, it's just meh.
author: Hannah M.

description:
the one on the top floor--- 
this place is apparently always just...mayhem. been there a handful of times now and it's usually the same thing. busy, lines, usually friendly staff, and big ice creams. Their outdoor seating is what we go for if we can find seating to get away from the chaos that is families and children running amok and shoulder-to-shoulder movement or seating. Giant collection of chocolate flavors, obviously.
author: A. I.

description:
Dream place for kids and tourists who love ice cream. 
We had hot chocolate, banana split, and more fun options they offered from the menu. 
Street parking
author: Sammy B.

description: Got myself for my ordering for ice cream place on my 1st week of fall break with my bff Paola so much, because she was my favorite person of all the time! So I ordered a Midnight Reverie, Sea Salt Caramel Sundae and I think that's it. So my bff just ordered Butterscotch Hot Fudge Sundae, because she liked it alot also.
author: Tatiana V.

description: Here I go.... **********ASK FOR VALIDATION******** this place had a huge line but the line goes in fast. If you are here with your family or whatever, you should make it to go and wait for them to call your name. Also once your order your sundae or whatever GET THE SPOON. They have tendency to run out of the spoons. My experience was okay, I have better sundae at Disneyland Ghirardelli than San Francisco. We took our order to the near beach and ate it there. Cup weren't even labeled Ghirardelli :-(
author: bilal s.

description:
Everything ice cream and chocolate all under one roof. The lines are long but the choices are aplenty. The quality is excellent, though. They have several desserts/sundaes that are named after San Francisco landmarks like Crissy Field, Ocean Beach,  Golden Gate, etc. Prices are in the $12 to $40 range. The Earthquake ($39.95) feeds 4 and has 8 scoops of ice cream and comes with 8 toppings. 

Ghirardelli...Quintessential San Francisco sweet treats.
author: Chuck D.

description: I'm still dreaming about this place. No doubt it was the best dessert place! Real chocolate desserts, real hot chocolate! Just amazing...
author: Julianna K.

description:
Came here for the first time last night, although I've tried the location in the Westfield mall. 

At first I didn't know where to order as there's a register I thought for merchandise purchases only and a counter. But then a gentleman who worked there gave out free peppermint samples and pointed me in the right direction.

I wanted to try the Crissy Fields sundae but it's quite large, to share wit another person. So I ordered the Treasure Island sundae instead which comes with a brownie, perfect serving size for one.

It came out really quick! The server was very kind asking if I needed anything else. The sundae looked delicious and it was!

I will admit it's pretty expensive considering some of the sundaes aren't much different than what you'd get from any other ice cream sundae place, aside from their fun names. The starting price is $12 to about $16. You'd be better off getting the Crissy Fields at $15 and splitting with another.

I came alone after an evening event but will definitely come back again with a friend! Love that it's open late too!
author: Monica G.

description: Been here multiple times over the years I love the smell when you first enter the store. I also like the sample chocolate they hand out when you are in line. I had choc fudge sundae  the last time was there. Not cheap but pretty good.
author: Sunil R.

description:
If you have a severe sweet tooth, this is definitively the ice cream shop for you. Anything you order here with chocolate will be overwhelmingly chocolate-y, as to be expected, but I warn you again! 

My friend and I got a Crissy Fields sundae to share, and we barely made a dent in it. The chocolate fudge, cookies and cream ice cream and two chocolate pieces on top were just too much chocolate for us, and that says a lot given how my friend loves sweets. The portion size is large enough for 4 or 5 people to share just because of the intense sweetness. Overall, it was a pretty average, overly sweet sundae. 

The tables were a bit sticky from previous customers, but other than that the decor is super cute and SF vibe. Would come back with more people next time!
author: Priscilla S.

description:
It was very nice but it is too sweet for korean.
Also I can give them to 5 stars if they changed chair to soft..
author: Hakjoo L.

description: Walked in and got a caramel square sampler from the guy at the door who explained all their sales. We got a scoop of yummy ice scream and some squares to go. Nice location and they do a decent job keeping the homeless out
author: Jennifer U.

description: Great ice cream and chocolates. Gets busy on weekends and evenings.  Great location. We tried the banana split and it was awesome.
author: Andrew P.

description: Ordered the split banana. Sufficiently large to be shared with someone else and so delicious. It has more than 1K calories if you care about your health :)
author: Mehrdad M.

description: Very pricy and very sweet. Tourist trap, but I knew it going in. Good service, friendly staff, and decent ice cream. The hot fudge is the best part but I can't get over the price for a sundae. $12 plus tax for two scoops, hot fudge, marshmallow cream, nuts and a cherry. I asked for no nuts but they put it in anyways. Luckily I'm not allergic. I'd go back here for special occasions and super hot days though.
author: Joanne T.

description: A fleeting thrill that can turn quickly into chocolate overkill. My recommendation is to order the more subtle entries off the menu. Even besides chocolate overloads, for instance, I ordered the Sea Salt Caramel Hot Cocoa and that became way too sweet after a few sips in and my entire face cringed. I had a good time with two scoops of vanilla and rocky road ice cream (such economy of balance!), and a bite of brownie was enough. I don't see how, though, anyone could not try famous "Ghirardelli" once, it's just one of those things you have to do. Just go in with the plan to order the more subtle chocolate items, or go milk chocolate. For me, I ate and drank everything because that's just what I do. #foodslut
author: Sean C.

description:
I can't comment on the ice cream -- which looked fabulous -- I can comment only the hazelnut latte and the great staff plus divine mini chocolates.  

Do yourself a favor and stop by in the AM for a latte from Ghirardelli.  The lattes here are honestly better than Starbucks, Peets, or Dunks if you like "flavored" coffee beverages.  Not too sweet, but just sweet enough with a nice warm nutty flavor.  I also loved that they included the calorie content on all of their food and beverage offerings.  But with chocolate shops, sometimes ignorance is bliss.  Chocolate bonus:  they basically have every kind of chocolate known to man sold here in bite size pieces.  Waste lines beware!  

I also wanted to comment on their great staff.  On a slow Sunday afternoon, I saw what appeared to be a homeless woman wander into the shop, eat off a dirty dish left by another customer before it could be taken away by the staff, and verbally assault one of the shop workers with racially (and nationality) charged comments.  The staff handled the situation professionally, calmly, and firmly.  I was very impressed.  Kudos to you guys!
author: Sarah M.

description: A must visit when in San Francisco. Beware the rush even on weekdays are crazy so be prepared to wait in line to get your favorite dessert. They do have a place where you can buy the chocolates assorted. Try their sea salt caramel sundae! You will not regret it. It's something different and not available everywhere. You can also see how chocolate is made there. They have some machines and chocolate flowing continuously.
author: Julia J.

description:
This shop is just down the street from my office, so it's very convenient to pick up chocolates for gifts, parties, etc. I'm always pleasantly surprised by the high level of customer service provided by all the workers, from the manager to the person who welcomes customers and hands out free samples. Everyone who enters the store is greeted with a smile and treated with dignity and courtesy. The large bags are the best bargain and provide a delicious assortment of the most popular varieties.
A top rating for this store!
author: Susan N.

description: Awesome ice cream. Lines are long and yes its touristy but they have the best chocolate and a very creamy ice cream. If you can handle a wait it's worth it. It's not as bad on weekdays, def in barely not a weekend thing unless you don't mind the wait..
author: Andrew M.

description: My daughter insisted on getting a brownie fudge sundae at this chocolate paradise. That one sundae was enough for the three of us to indulge in chocolate heaven. I'm an ice cream snob and I could tell they use good quality vanilla ice cream with this sundae.
author: Franklin M.

description: The new remodel is GORGEOUS, so much more spacious and modern and I love the San Diego line of chocolate!
author: Kelsey H.

description: Tasty and open late right at the Montgomery bart. I ordered the strike it rich butterscotch sundae. It was delicious and very filling. The icecream was good but the real stars were the butterscotch and Ghirardelli hot fudge. It definitly hit the spot. Take advantage too of yelps dollar off offer.
author: Sean G.

description:
Yummy ice cream, on the extra sweet side but that's OK.
Just be careful going to and from there and watch your step on the sidewalks outside; this is San Francisco - Post Modern Version 2.0.  That means, watch out for the human waste and toxic waste outside.
author: Ricardo O.

description: I love the idea of stopping in here when I happen to be in the vicinity but tend to regret it a bit once I actually go. Don't get me wrong, the actual treats are wonderful! But the whole experience in the jam packed inside isn't exactly an enjoyable one which definitely takes away from it all for me. I much prefer the Ghiradelli in California Adventure for that reason alone.
author: Karina M.

description:
If you've never been to a Ghirardelli shop and you're in SF, go to Ghirardelli Square (near Fisherman's Wharf) to the original store to get the full experience. Trust me, it's worth it. 

However, this particular location was in my neck of the woods for a work conference and I was craving something sweet and it was rainy...so I went here. It's on the Market/Montgomery Street corner.

Reasons this wasn't as thrilling a visit:

+Upon entry, a worker awkwardly gave me a wrapped square of chocolate. Like just kind of shoved it in my face. Thanks? Would've appreciated an explanation - "this is a seasonal flavor" "this bar is on sale today" etc.

+Prices are steep like at all the Ghirardelli shops - the classic hot fudge sundae is $13 after tax. Oof. But easily split between two people. However, I felt the signature hot fudge was a bit sticky, like it hadn't been heated up/melted enough.

+Overall, it lacks the charm and history that the original Ghirardelli store has to offer.

If you're in a pinch, need a sweet (or a gift of chocolate) and find yourself in the neighborhood, stop here. Otherwise, go to the original store.
author: Katie U.

description:
Frequent this place constantly. When shopping for items around the store, service is always hit or miss. Sometimes there's someone there that is super enthused to help you find the right gift items for your occasion, others, there's a person who comes off as if that day is the worst day of his/her life, so you shouldn't even make eye contact, much less ask them a question about a product, because it will just end badly/sadly. 

I definitely try to shop during non-peak hours, early morning or later evening so I can mix and match baskets, or check out their new gift items without having to dodge a lot of people there to order hot beverages or giant ice cream creations. There are great items wrapped up in pretty packaging or SF-themed if you're looking for family gifts, holiday treats, or corporate packages. 

The shop is definitely adorable, it's in the corner of the historic Palace hotel, and the set up is like an old fashion soda fountain. Definitely one of those tourist traps when it comes to the $10-$12 ice cream sundaes, but it's a festive experience and you can sit along the windowsill making passersby/foot commuters jealous with the massive ice cream creations. 

Suggestion: espresso-based drinks/coffees are often on the weak side, so save your caffeine trip for the coffeehouses, and keep your visit ice cream and chocolate-focused.
author: Alison A.

description: Excellent! First time coming here and must say their ice cream sundaze are wicked! We tried the sea salt chocolate sundae (small) for two. At 1160 calories it was way more than expected. Definitely coming back here sometime in the future !
author: Harry H.

description: I love chocolate. Their signature sundane definitely worth a try, they all come in family size, so good to share. Love the hot chocolate too.
author: Alicia T.

description:
Ghirardelli is iconic and a must-visit for every visitor to San Francisco, particularly foodies and chocoholics. It's busy and expensive, but the wait is usually worth it. Try to get your hands on one of the paper menus so you can decide what you want to eat while you're waiting. There are several specialty sundaes but I think the build your own is the way to go. It's not widely known that they offer sugar free vanilla ice cream. I usually get that with their delicious hot fudge (not sugar free) and marshmallow topping (also not sugar free) on top. I realize I am a walking contradiction but I don't care!

In the back there's a chocolate machine with melted chocolate that smells so good and is fun to watch. It's a self-guided "tour" and seems to really intrigue children. 

Make sure you pay a visit to the adjacent chocolate shop too: you'll be given a free sample square (individually sealed) of a delicious Ghirardelli chocolate candy! (Cheapskate alert: you can often go through multiple times and collect more than one sample).
author: Louisa M.

description: Very touristy chocolate shop. I was very glad that security was screening out the homeless that would loiter inside every now and then. Very nice location. But was dissapointed with their cold drinks. I went here just to try it out. Explains why only tourists come in here. I like their products but the cafe could be a lot more enticing with improved menu
author: Beatrice T.

description: Such a disappointment! The Sunday was basically served in a Starbucks frapuccino cup (we requested to have it on-site, not to go) and was basically vanilla ice cream and shell syrup. I was expecting better from Ghirardelli hometown. I do like that they're open late for an unexpected sweet craving at night.
author: Jessica S.

description: Popped in for some hot tea during a chilly lunch break. Bought a hot tea and couldn't help but getting some chocolate squares. But the icing on a cake was a complimentary sorbet! So that made my day and made my lunch hour SWEET
author: D S.

description:
OMG!  I've been here so many times and it never disappoints.  I went there at the end of August and they had a special sundae that I really hope they will add to their usual offerings.  The Ocean Beach Sundae (a sea salt, caramel sundae with hot fudge, caramel and salt) was to die for.  I had one scoop of vanilla and one of espresso chip.  I was worried it might be too sweet, but it was not.  It was superb.

I did have a bit of trouble with the tables not being cleaned, but the manager handled it wonderfully and even gave me some candies for my trouble.  Overall, a great experience
author: Susan R.

description: Obviously I had to make a trip here! My friend and I both got sundaes. She got their famous brownie sundae and I got their butterscotch sundae! Both were delicious, but Huge! I recommend coming here hungry and in the mood for sundaes lol!
author: Tahini R.

description: I love this place so much that when a friend and I were in town, we skipped traditional dinner and ate ice cream instead. We shared a monstrous Sunday and did the happy dance with each bite. Every topping was rich and decadent and that chocolate... yum yum yum! if you are in the SF Bay Area, you have to do yourself a favor and drop in. there are barrels of candy, the staff are incredibly friendly, you get free chocolate tasters when you walk in, AND THE PRICES ARE GREAT! This is definitely one of the places that I hit every single time I am out that way. I also love the history that's associated with the square and this shop. I like to mosey around and read the little placards and old photos with captions of the way things used to be... it definitely makes me feel like I'm adulting while eating like a 5 year old.. all for the sake of cherishing history.. it's a tough job, but someone's gotta do it :-p
author: Rucinda S.

description:
This place is supposed to be great for its ice cream and chocolates. The prices caused alarm and me grab my wallet as if i was being pick pocketed. I took a deep breath and ordered the banana split, which costs $15. While waiting at the table i started having anxiety and buyers remorse cause $15 goes a long way in the mid west, and i wasn't in Kansas anymore. 

When my tin boat of frozen dairy and sugary confection arrived my fears were allayed as i took the first spoonful of the chocolate side, and a piece of banana, and i realized this is not a national chain, which uses artificial flavors and ingredients ( is it even made of dairy?). And there we go, the secret to this treat was the nice thick and creamy consistency of real dairy. Of course there was whipped cream, sprinkled with chopped nuts, along with chocolate syrup. With a cherry on top.

I recommend visiting Ghirardelli Square and getting any of their ice cream treats. It is worth the money and makes for a memorable authentic experience to Fisherman's Wharf and SF as a whole. You will be happy you did so.
author: William B.

description:
I am boggled by the fact that I have not written a review before since I have been here many, many times and have LOVED it every time!!!

There is nothing more quintessentially San Francisco that Ghiradelli. The ice cream concoctions are to swoon over, and you can buy delicious chocolates to take with you as a bonus!

This is a must stop on every trip to SF. It takes you back in time to the institutions of old SF and all of it's charm. If you have never been, GO. If you have, keep going. Enjoy. SMILE. This is what life is all about.
author: Lauren C.

description:
The ice cream at any Ghiradelli's store is consistently delicious, but I do think it is pretty overpriced. Luckily there is a $1 discount with a Yelp check-in! The ordering process is easy, and they hand you a number and bring out your sundae to you when it is ready. I treated my two friends to a Golden Gate sundae (vanilla, chocolate, and strawberry ice cream scoops with hot fudge, fresh fruit, a banana and whipped cream, $12.45). The ice cream itself was creamy and smooth, although it was difficult to actually taste much of the ice cream itself because of the toppings (not that I'm complaining... I love the toppings). The hot fudge was particularly rich and chocolatey, and I like that they gave ample whipped cream.

I took off one star because of the value - almost $13 for an ice cream sundae is pretty pricey!
author: Amy C.

description:
Great place to get a sundae and anything ghiradelli! Definitely a tourist trap- i walk by this place everyday on my way to work and people are eating huge sundaes at 10am! Weird.

Came on the hottest day of the year in SF and we definitely had to hover for tables.

They have a lot of staff but they need to do a better job at cleaning the tables- everything was sticky.

Sundaes run 10-15 and are perfect for 2 to share. The brownie one we had was delish! I don't like that they ass sea salt to it but that might be your thing sweet/savory.

They merchandise is all adorable and SF themed. If i wasn't local i would definitely buy it as a souvenir for friends and familu. Super overpriced though!!!
author: Erica D.
Robin H.

description: Always crowded but worth the wait! If you do t have a big appetite you can order a single scoop with toppings! I love hot fudge on cookies n cream! Yum yum
author: Kerry K.

description: My husband and I came here on a Monday since it was impossible to get in on the weekend without waiting for an hour. We ordered the hot fudge sundae, thinking it was going to be huge since we paid just about $14 for it. Keep in mind California charges 4% "unhealthy food" tax. The lady slammed the sundae on the table and said enjoy. Pretty much every employee here was less than heppy to be working it seemed. And for the sundae it was less than exceptional. I could have made this sundae at home for 2 bucks. Not sure why people flock here.
author: Alyssa M.

description: Yum! Yum! Yum!!! Great service by Everett who noted it was international sundae day and 1/2 off our old fashioned sundae! Very personable and attentive.
author: Melanie B.

description:
Place - good place to acess. Pretty many tables and less crowd than Ghiradelli square. You don't need to wait to order or get table. There also offter same prodects like Ghiradelli sqaure. 

Taste - Good. Sweet but not tooooo sweet. I love browny with ice cream. Treasure Island is good for two people. Drink is not too special but vanilla latte is great! If you ask a whip cream on it, they will do for your drink.

Price and Service - price is not too expensive just tourist place. Service is not that good. A person who gave a free chicolate was nice but evey time I visited here, cashers were not nice.
author: Da Won L.

description: It's everything you would expect for a top tier chocolate place. The staff is very accommodating and welcoming, the chocolate is rich and the servings are plentiful. The Treasure Island Sundae is absolutely delicious!
author: Michael W.

description:
The ice cream is delicious and free chocolate when you walk in is always a plus! 

Came into the store during the afternoon with a group and the place was packed, there was no place to sit. We decided to get the banana split with strawberry, chocolate, and vanilla ice cream. The ice cream was prepared pretty quickly and tasted delicious. However, the spoons they gave us were already USED! Like there were some chocolate dried on the spoon probably from making a previous dessert. When we notified one of the people worked there he, he just looked at it and then snatched it out of my hands. No apology and no new spoon. So we grabbed the plastic ones and then he realizes it. However, other people seem to have a great time and Ghiradelli is a iconic place to visit when one is in San Francisco. 

Bottom line, this is a great addition to San Francisco with great desserts but the service could be a hit or miss!
author: Jeanette Q.

description:
If you're looking for a quick getaway in The City or just need your sweet-tooth fix, look no further!

Conveniently right off the Montgomery BART stop, you can get $1 off an ice cream sundae simply by checking in.
author: Roger D.

description:
How could you go wrong with ice cream and chocolate?? 


You can't.. lol 
Best dessert in town!!
author: Tina K.

description: LOOOOVE! Aside from the delicious sundaes, the customer service is awesome. My intentions were to get my sundae to go because parking is ridiculous however, I was treated to well that I decided to sit down and enjoy my ice cream. I was greeted as soon as I walked in and got my sample. The cashier, Jess, was beyond nice and helpful. The person who made my Sundae, Emiliano, went out of his way to make sure my order was prepared and ready to go. Like I mentioned before, I wanted my sundae to go so he made sure I had extra napkins and an extra bowl so ice cream wasn't all over the place. I enjoyed talking to the employees so much that I was sitting down before I knew it. I ended up ordering chocolate covered strawberries before I was done with my first order. Lastly, the store is very clean and well stocked. Everything in there is pricey but it is definitely worth it. I wish I lived closer.
author: Margarita B.

description: If you want to have "TASTE SEX" with chocolate - this is the place!!! We had the hot fudge sundae with a brownie --had to share--too much to eat for one person--sooo damn deelish! Bought a large bag of caramel and chocolate to go!!!
author: Margaret B.

description: Other that being way over priced for what you get, it was delicious as usual.  It's a family tradition every time we go to San Francisco.
author: Matilda Q.

description: Now this is a great dessert stop! They make quite a few different desserts to choose from, you really can't go wrong. If your in the area stop here or if your in Boston stop at there location or whatever there's a location by you stop there. Service is always good and everyone seems helpful. Every time I leave here I'm satisfied! If you LOVE Chocolate then this place is a must stop for you. Hope you ENJOY!
author: Al C.

description: The desserts here are so good. And the prices are not even that bad. Me and my friends shared the banana split and the lands end. My friend also got the sea salt caramel got chocolate which was also good.
author: Audrey A.

description: I decided to check this place out with my brother and sister in law and I was honestly disappointed. Don't get me wrong the ice cream is very delicious, but I would rather just go to Cold Stone or Baskin Robins. Their portion sizes for their ice creams are HUGE and I just love how beautifully designed the place is. It is a little pricey for the ice cream, but it's only because it's enough to feed a family of 5. If you're looking to have a good time def check this place out, it's located in a very beautiful area filled with a lot of fun attractions.
author: Neloffer E.

description: Not impressed whatsoever. Staff harried, rushed and less than pleasant. Had to buss and clean tables as they were filthy and staff showed no initiative to clean up. Ice cream flavor was good however minimal hot fudge and Sunday toppings were given considering a $13 price tag for a two scoop sundae. Will not be going back to Ghirardelli.. total tourist t
author: Joanie W.

description: This shop smells amazingly sweet. As soon as you walk in, the aroma of chocolate surrounds you and forces you to try some ice cream. I went for the classic chocolate ice cream, which was a generous scoop and tasted good, but not better than chocolate ice cream at our local ice cream shops in Oklahoma. I'm not even sure it's worth the experience, as the shop is very small and you can buy Ghirardelli Chocolate pretty much anywhere.
author: Ciara D.

description: If have have not heard of Ghirardelli then please find a flashlight and get out of your cave. Stopping at this place well in San Francisco was as important and seeing the Golden gate Bridge. Well, maybe not that important but pretty darn important. As soon enter you are greeted with free chocolate and the aroma of all the tasty treats you been dreaming of you since you're a kid. I must admit there was a little bit of sticker shock as we approached the counter and looked at the menu pricing but when in Rome spend as the Romans do I guess. We ordered the Crissy Field sunday. By the way there is a one dollar off checking offer! We ordered one to split his we figured that would be enough as we already had a huge dinner. Boy was I wrong I could've ate two of those things not because they're small but because they are so good. My brain does not know when to say stop. Aside from the crazy pricing, I was completely pleased. Maybe next time we will stop here first and eat dinner second ha ha. We gathered a few Christmas presents on our way out for all of our friends and family.Rest assured we'll be back as soon as we can!
author: Eric S.

description: When in San Francisco on Christmas Day, there are not many options for desert. However, Ghirardelli is open on Christmas Day, the essential San Francisco ice cream/fudge parlor. I ordered the amazingly and seductively delicious and sweet original hot fudge sundae with no whipped cream. The hot fudge was seductively delicious and the best part of the sundae. The vanilla ice cream did its job and it was delicious. The nuts and maraschino cherry complemented the seductive sweetness of the sundae. This Ghirardelli was full of classic San Francisco pre-hipster vibes and bits of classic Americana. However, there was a hair in my sundae which is why I shalt only grant this Ghirardelli four stars. Overall, Ghirardelli is still home to San Francisco's best hot fudge sundae and is an essential stop for every San Francisco tourist. Finally, to obtain the full Ghirardelli experience, one must head to Ghirardelli Square.
author: Nick C.

description:
I super love this place,  i.e. the style, the airiness, the deserts, the shakes and the CHOCOLATES. 
This is one of those desert places that one just want to sit and eat there heart out without worrying about the calories. 

Now let's about the deserts enough said about the place. 

Lands End (Salted caramel brownies sundae) - I am still drooling a bit when I think about it. So yummy, loved the warm sundae with creamy ice cream. 
It was so gooey and fresh !!! 


Strike it Rich (Butterscotch hot fudge sundae) - I liked the saltiness of this drink, very unique blend of flavour with creamy ice cream and butterscotch filling. 

P.S. We spotted a hair in the salted caramel brownie sundae and when I mentioned it, they were sweet enough to acknowledge it, said sorry and didn't charge me for it. 

I would definitely go here again !!! Great staff, excellent service and free chocolate when you enter
author: Simran K.

description:
I thought about going to 2 stars, but I honestly could not think of one reason why I should. I thought maybe because I didn't personally eat any chocolate? But my friends did, so screw that. I thought maybe am I biased because I'm not a tourist? But screw that too. They should be able to serve Bay Areans and make them happy too. 

Went with some co-workers to get an afternoon snack, and I got a $6 cappuccino. Worst capp I've ever had. It was mostly milk, and lukewarm at best, and by the time I got to my office it was cold. My friends both got brownies and said it tasted like they were store bought, frozen, and re-heated. They fell apart into crumbles. The staff at the register were kinda rude, supremely disinterested with working, it seemed. Even the guy handing out chocolate samples didn't smile. Kind of the worst place ever in my opinion.
author: Nikki G.

description:
Wish they have these places more in Southern California because this is a real treat. Not only is there walls of chocolate to pick from but they offer a variety of ice cream Sundae that are sure to make everyone in your group happy with their favorite twists of a Ice cream sundae. 

I would recommend this place to anyone visiting the area that is looking to quench their sweet tooth with something of good quality that is affordable for city prices.
author: Ryan S.

description: Very, very disappointed. I live in SF and love Ghirardelli, visiting often. My wife and I ordered the World Famous Hot Fudge Sundae and was completely disappointed. The ice cream had ice crystals and it was served in a plastic cup. My guess is this is pre-made and frozen in the plastic cups. I asked the staff and they would not answer if they were pre-made. They kept avoiding the question and would not remake the sundae. For $11.95 I do not expect icicles in my ice cream or the cheap ice cream they made it with. Out of fear this ice cream was defroasted and refrozen (which causes the ice crystals and is a health code issue) we tossed the sundae in the trash. Do not purchase this so called World Famous Hot Fudge Sundae.
author: Michael C.

description: Love the shakes and the customer service. The shakes and hot chocolate were really good.  On our way out one of employees could see we stopped there before we made our way out for our flight and gave us extra chocolate for the trip out. Really loved that and gonna make sure to always visit for the hot coco and customer service.
author: Michael R.

description: Ice cream was good but not worth 12 dollars. The pictures on the menu make the sundaes etc. look way larger than they actually are.
author: Amanda R.

description: Heavy and super sweet but yum sundae. Also, they have these huge machine mixing chocolate. Very cool.
author: Mini K.

description:
Went there on a visit to sf during my husband's birthday weekend. Since it was someone's birthday so both of us were not counting the calories ;) As soon as we entered we were given a free sample of their new chocolate. It was a milk chocolate and tasted good. We grabbed a place to sit and started thinking about ordering something. Well let me tell you, their menu has a lotsss of options :D So you might end up spending extra time thinking on what to get. At one point, you might think of getting everything on the menu :D :D But after much discussion we decided to go with a scoop of vanilla ice-cream, topped with molten sweet chocolate fudge and topped with chopped almonds. It came in a waffle cone dipped in chocolate. 

If I tell you that it tasted awesome then it will be an understatement ;) It tasted like heaven. Their ice-cream was so rich and creamy and tasted way better than many vanilla ice-creams that I have ever had anywhere. The molten fudge tasted simply amazing and it was the highlight of the entire item. The fudge became thick after sometime but it still tasted awesome. 

This place had ample seating and lines were short. Everyone was served quickly even though there was a huge foot traffic. I will definitely come back with friends and family.
author: Bharti K.

description:
Yes, it's super touristy to go to a Ghiradelli store.  But sometimes you want a decadent sundae and they do that well!  Plus the ambiance of the fancy Plaza Hotel is a bit nicer than the overcrowded Ghiradelli Square or a mall basement.  So as a local, I'll admit, sometimes I do indulge.

Land's End: A very generous amount of syrup (chocolate & caramel), which in my opinion is the most important part of a sundae.  A brownie was split in two and placed on each end of the bowl.  It was a tasty brownie, but a bit more cakey than fudgy; I prefer fudgy.  They used vanilla ice cream, which is the perfect blank canvas to let those other ingredients shine.  Splitting among two people, you both leave with a nice sugar buzz.  Not sure how one person could take down this monstrosity though!
author: Adam B.

description: The ice cream portion is very good, staffs are super welcoming handing out candies constantly.
author: Jane W.

description: I came in to get two caramel lattes and a chocolate covered strawberry and a chocolate chip cookie and Josalyn charged me for the more expensive chocolate covered strawberry and forgot to put it in the bag because she was so busy trying to upsell me on getting an additional brownie that I clearly wasn't interested in purchasing. I just am very unhappy with the customer service and even worse I paid for a strawythat I never got. I hope that management reviews this and helps their staff understand that they don't need to upsell so hard that they mess up what the customer actually wants.
author: Emilee M.

description: These few blocks of FiDi are pretty dead on the weekends so you'll definitely find seats. The desserts are standard with what other Ghirardelli stores around the country serve (i.e. gigantic portions of sweetness) but if you're visiting Ghirardelli as an SF sight to see, probably better off going to Ghirardelli Square :)
author: Elise P.

description: Ugh, what i miss living in LA? Getting to visit the Ghirardelli when passing through Hollywood. But thankfully the Bay is close by to get my sundae fix. One of the best
author: Cyndi L.

description:
The original! We walked all the way over here from Fisherman's wharf, so we had worked up an appetite! We shared a chocolate sundae & we were not disappointed. There a great view of the water from where we were seated. We didn't eat in the main restaurant but the store cafe, which was perfect for us since there were shorter lines.
It's in a nice area with different stores and a beer garden too! Worth a visit for chocolate lovers.
author: Shelly S.

description:
After having a belated V-day dinner at my most recent discovery Mourad for the second time in 2 months, we made sure to save room to head over to the Ghirardelli Ice Cream & Chocolate Shop for dessert just a few blocks away.  

I was excited to find that there was another ice cream shop option outside of what can often be a too touristy and crowded Ghirardelli Square on the weekends.  Attached to the Palace Hotel where you can enter through the hotel or from the street side, this shop has a good blend of tourist and locals.  In the midst of the Financial District and close to the Downtown area so right by BART, it is a perfect location to drop by to pick up chocolates for yourself or gifts for others.  Like most stores, as you enter, you are greeted with a complimentary square to whet your palate before you dive into the many choices available.  

Since our home is already on chocolate overload these days, we came for the Ice Cream Sundaes.  Starting at $10.95 for Sundaes served in the Sundae glasses to up to $39.95 for the 8 scoop Earthquake meant for 4, we settled for the middle ground and split a $13.50 Land's End Salted Caramel Brownie Sundae served on a Sundae boat.  The brownie was soft and a perfect pairing for the ice cream.  I do wish they were less heavy handed with the whip cream though as the entire first bite for both of us was all whipped cream and strange that they do not remove your # after they serve you your order.  That meant having to pick up the sticky number tag and return to the counter yourself.  

But overall, enjoy having an easier to get to location for a decadent Sundae fix.
author: Joyce Z.

description:
Love the chocolate? Then why not try other items to offer.  The store is small with limited seating, by there is additional seating outside.  Today was actually a super hot day but still this place was hopping with a line and seats were full. Many people also enjoyed their purchase to go and walk and enjoy the area around the water.
When you walk in they served us their today's choice of chocolate, as my husband stated, wow this is actually super good!  He thought it was just a huge hype because of the name and now gets why people love it.  So smooth and tasty it makes you want to buy everything in the store.  That small start of a teaser can get you to want more and before you know it you bought ice cream and chocolates to take home to family.
Something about buying the chocolate from the store makes it more valuable then buying it from the grocery store. 
If you are close to this store you gotta check it out, it's one of popular San Fran things to do while in town.
author: Sanaz M.

description: Hot Fudge Sundae? The fudge was hard and cold. The ice cream was nothing special and had ice crystals in it. All this deliciousness for $13. That's right, $13 for a mediocre sized crappy hot fudge sundae. Don't bother.
author: B B.

description:
Review #231 - 2016

Showed up with my nephew on a Saturday night around 10:30 PM and the place was packed.  We were kind of hesitant about ordering because we weren't sure if we would find a seat since it's self-seating.

After we placed our orders, a few tables became available so we took a seat and waited for our desserts.  My nephew had the 2 scoops of ice cream on a waffle cone.  He actually asked for one scoop of chocolate, but I wanted to try the butter pecan so I just added that extra scoop to his order.  I went with a large cup of sea salted caramel hot cocoa minus the whip.

For a pretty expensive chocolatier, I was expecting the food to show up in a more presentable manner; the ice cream on the waffle cone showed up lying down on a platter, which definitely made for an ugly photo op.  At least the ice cream tasted better than they looked.  Their butter pecan is probably one of best that I've tasted.  The chocolate wasn't too bad either.

However, my hot cocoa was extremely sweet.  So sweet to the point that my throat started to hurt as soon as I took a few sips.  I had to ask for ice water just to wash all that sugar down.  My hot cocoa was supposed to be served with a side of milk chocolate square, but I guess they must have forgotten because I never got one.

I'll probably never come back being that parking is already a pain, and to top that off, the desserts just aren't worth the extra trip.  I would've been happier with my Godiva soft serve at this point.
author: Sivilay T.

description: Simply delicious! It's always crowded but worth the wait.... and you get a free chocolate as you walk in! Yum!!
author: Jenn L.

description: This place is always great to visit when we are in San Francisco. My kids and I seem to always over indulge ourselves and walk away feeling like a glutton. I always get a banana split sundae and end up finishing whatever leftovers my children don't get to. There are definitely lines every time I've been here, but it's a tourist attraction so it's a given.
author: Michael L.

description:
With Ghirardelli Square being so out of the way, this location is perfect to experience what the chocolate giant has to offer. The second we walked in, we were handed chocolate square samples for free, which is always a plus. I was craving a dessert of some sort this night so I opted to get their chocolate milkshake (almost $7). It was delicious and just what I needed. 

I definitely recommend it if you're into sweets, and definitely for tourists who want to check out something local and specific to San Francisco.
author: Emma W.

description: Great place to battle your sweet tooth, really enjoyed the Sundaes.  Would recommend to anyone who like banana splits.
author: Kenneth M.

description: The food was amazing, I ordered a chocollet mousse. The Dow side is  the wait seemed like forever. And for a Tuesday evening??!!
author: Brandy W.

description: Just as I imagined. Get the ice cream and coffee items. You can get the chocolate cheaper at your local grocery. The views are breathtaking. You can see Alcatraz from one seating area. We sat outside and had our coffee and ice cream. There was good live music at and it was great people watching.
author: Courtney S.

description: We got the Treasure Island and the Golden Gate, both of the sundaes are too sweet. They need to clean their tables. The price is not cheap for a sundae. Our total bill was about $27 with SF health Tax 4%.
author: Mike L.

description:
Like Chocolate, like ice-cream blend together and you get a happy place!

This Ghirardelli store not only sells it delicious famous chocolate but also ice-cream delights which you can sit in and enjoy.

Staff friendly and you start to the 'happy place' is a member of staff offering you a piece of free chocolate.  How can that be a bad start to anything!

Ice cream delight served quickly and I have nothing bad to say about it!!  I will be back and back again!
author: Paula M.

description: I did not realize they had three locations around this area and all 3 of them have a line out the door.  The only problem is one of the stores does have the homeless smell to it so it might ruin your appetite when eating it. The line moves very fast and quick. We ordered the sundaes, the Gold Strike which is butterscotch and a lot of ice cream and the cherry vanilla sundae, I forgot what is the name of it. Do not look at the calories as it might well not convince you to go as most of them are over 1000 calories. But since we played Pokemon all day, it is all good.
author: Keven W.

description: Got 2 sundaes and they were just subpar. The fudge was Cold, whipped cream tastes like whipped oil. Ice cream had frozen chunks in it. Like it had been in the freezer way too long
author: Chad E.

description:
IF YOU HAVE A NUT ALLERGY THEY WILL STILL PUT NUTS IN YOUR SUNDAE. Went here today around 3-4ish with a couple friends visiting from out of town. One was severely allergic to different types of nuts so we double precaution and asked for no nuts(almonds from the twin peak sunday). 

When we got our sundae we didn't taste the almonds until we were halfway through eating it. Honestly I didn't want almonds anyway. I quickly went to the people making it and asked if they could remake it because there was nuts in and my friend was ALLERGIC to nuts. 

For some reason, one of the workers came back to us and asked if we had chocolate in our sundae(yes?!) and  even though I kept saying yes and that I got the twin peaks one, she sounded hella confused acting like she didn't know what was on the menu when the menu specifically said there was chocolate in the twin peaks sundae... AND THEN SHE SAID "there's almonds, not nuts in this" and in my head I'm like ??? Isn't almonds a specific nut? And even if I was wrong I still meant that I didn't want almonds in my damn sundae anyways. Idk why she even telling us this.. cus obviously someone can be allergic to multiple nuts...

The order comes back and the top icecream is fine but the middle part HAD ALMONDS AGAIN. I'm assuming they didn't even remake it but added new icecream to the top without almonds. We didn't even finish it once I ate it again and found almonds STILL IN IT. Next time inform your staff that if someone says they're allergic, don't freaking question it and make a freaking NEW one because you're gambling with people's LIVES. He might of not been severely allergic to almonds specifically, but someone else could of been and because of your careless, lazy employees(there was like 5 behind that counter) they could of died or had to go to the hospital.
author: Jennifer C.

description: Typical Ghirardelli store right outside of Montgomery BART station. This store has a multitude of chocolate and a sit down section for those oh so sugary desserts. Typically, you are given a sample of chocolate when you enter the store or when you are processing your purchase with a cashier. You have everything from full chocolate bars, Ghirardelli minis, SF themed packaging, and combo packs in this store. The dessert menu has a good variety as well and includes sundaes, splits, brownies, milkshakes, and more. Prices are, as expected, a bit high, but you do get a good taste and overall experience at this store.
author: Lakshmi M.

description:
After meeting a dear friend for dinner, he wanted something sweet like ice cream so I checked Yelp and whaddaya know, there was an ice cream shop a couple blocks away. Eating ice cream when it's a wee bit cold outside can seem counterintuitive but it's ice cream so this detail can be overlooked. 

When you go into the shop it can be overwhelming with walls and stations of chocolate, chocolate and more chocolate. They had tons of gift baskets and bars that you can stock up to bring home and enjoy.

We ordered Cookies 'n Cream and Chocolate Chip Cookie dough in a cup. In normal ice cream places you get a small paper cup with one scoop of ice cream. Ghiradelli made it classy with a generous scoop, an ice cream glass and a long spoon. 

It was super decadent and a perfect way to end a lovely evening,
author: Nette T.

description: We have been to many Ghirardelli Ice Cream parlors over the years, but this one was the biggest. It had many different stores around the square, including four Ghirardelli Stores. A must do for chocolate lovers!
author: Mark H.

description:
This is probably my favourite Ghirardelli shop out of the three Ghirardelli's I have been to in San Francisco.

Entering, we were given a complimentary chocolate - I think they're promoting the minis lately. DE-LI-CIOUS. What a smart way to get people to purchase them. They are currently selling 80 minis or 80 of their regular chocolates (which are heavier) for about $27.95 which is really worth it for so much chocolates!

This environment is very open and has plenty of seats for those who would like to sit down for a sundae or a drink. We got the brownie sundae (treasure island) in a waffle bowl for about $13.50. The brownie was delicious, it was chewy, with a lot of fudge beneath it. The ice cream was alright, well of course, Ghirardelli specializes in chocolate, so I wouldn't expect their ice cream to be amazing. Their waffle bowl was dipped in chocolate, usually in other places, you would need to pay extra, but I suppose for a chocolate shop, chocolate dipped waffle bowl is the only option. It had a little TOO much chocolate in my opinion, I would like it if it had less chocolate, so I can have a taste to the waffle bowl, or I would hope that they can give an option of a waffle bowl without chocolate.

The staff are really friendly as one of them kindly let me know that she will be right with me to open the washroom door (code) for me as she was finishing up checkout for another customer.
author: Kristy N.

description: Tip: my favorite is the hot fudge sundae. But it's too much. I just discovered that I can order one scoop and add the topping. Perfect!
author: Lori W.

description: I mean come on if you love chocolate, ice cream, and lots of calories then you have arrived at your destination! Very touristy to say the least but I think that is expected duh...........you are in SF right near the water. Ok it is always packed, parking is a mess on a busy day also expected. But the menu is off the charts.................I thought I was going to have a heart attack if we stayed there longer! Chocolate so rich, Ice cream so "creamy" sorry that is the only adjective that comes to mind, you had to be there with me, to know what I mean! Overall you just cant come to this city and not visit them period!
author: Ray K.

description: Best ice cream in the city and a significant radius beyond.  You will not find a creamier ice cream that packs so much deep flavor in each bite.  Everything else will seem icy and generic after you've tried it here. You will love their flavor.
author: Michelle D.

description: Okay so here's the scenario. It's late night and freezing. We were out looking at Christmas lights on the house is. Then the Sweet Tooth overtook us and all we could think about was hot chocolate. But who wants to just have a regular old hot chocolate. No we want to go to Ghirardelli in San Francisco on Market Street and go in and have one of their sea salt and caramel hot chocolate with a wafer of chocolate goodness floating on top and whipped cream. Oh yeah they did it all. Well so I had the chocolate brownies topped with ice cream. Yes it was cold. But we didn't care. We just ate chocolate. And we were all good. Great place to go in the evening great place for kids and you love everybody will find something that they like.
author: Thomas B.

description: I don't understand what all the hype is about. This is an absurdly over priced ice cream place. The employees are incredibly rude. The hot chocolate tastes like room temperature water, no flavor at all.  They messed up our order and all they could do is roll their eyes and blame us. Don't waste your time or money. You can find better else where.
author: Alexandra M.

description:
Went here for a quick sundae on sunday! I ordered just a Mint Chocolate Chip Ice Cream Cup with sprinkles, whip cream and a cherry! I was a bit sad to see they used chocolate chips instead of sprinkles, but felt bad having them remake it. Overall it was delicious, but became way to chocolately, if that is even possible.
When I come back I'll probably order something else.
This location always has super nice lobby staff who offer you a free chocolate sample, and the store smells amazing!
author: Larissa S.

description: Excellent place. Nice service and really yummy dessert. It was really GOOD!!! Very large selection of different chocolates. I learned a new terminology too. "Intense dark chocolate". wow you have to try it!
author: Jimmy P.

description: IMPORTANT PUBLIC SERVICE - Ghirardelli is suppose to bring a smile to your face and joy to your heart  delicious ice cream in a magical environment served by happy happy employees - but (now here's the warning folks) step inside the location at New Montgomery and Market and you will find just the opposite experience - made the mistake on going in there Saturday night around 930 pm and it was gloomy - employees who looked and acted miserable - an environment that wasn't magical but pitiful - dirty looking and no sparkle to be found - ice cream served in plastic cups with plastic spoons as we sat down at a table - don't make the same mistake - either go to the original one or just go into a supermarket to the frozen food section and get a tub of any ice cream - you won't regret and you'd be thankful you followed this advice - I know ice cream and this isn't it -
author: Phillip S.

description: Worth the visit and stop! Still the same as when I first visited here. A San Francisco favorite
author: Mariana T.

description: Hands down the best sundaes. Super tasty chocolate fudge is to die for! So delicious that you won't want to share! Unfortunately, the prices are extremely high so be prepared to spend 10$
author: Crystal R.

description: This place is way too convenient! Catch the BART Montgomery station and you are right on the doorstep. The meet and greet is very sweet as you are offered a chocolate as well as assistance. Today, my 3yr old companion got two for being so good. She learnt last week here that good behaviour has its rewards so she doubled to an angelic level today.
author: Sue L.

description: Came here after the Giants game last week with my wife, son, mother in law, and lilttle bro in law.  The lines for Ghirardelli was a bit too long at the ballpark so I suggested afterwards stopping off at one of my favorite chocolate shops connected with the Palace Hotel. I had a sundae, while my wife ordered hot cocoa,  My brother in law is 3 and only had 5 blocks of sea salt carmel chocolate squares, and my mother in law succumbed to temptation and ordered and enjoyed here banana split.  This place will always make your tummy happy and wanting more. Truly hoping to keep Ghirardelli a special family tradition for years to come.
author: Ben D.

description:
******************** 1572 ********************

This is my go-to to show my customers or business colleagues when they come here for a conference with me at the Moscone Center. It's just a few blocks walking distance to get the famous San Francisco chocolate to bring home for their loved ones. 

They let you try a sample when you first walk in. The store is nice, clean, and in the historic building adjacent to the Palace Hotel.

They don't offer white chocolate, did you know that? But their cafe offers hot chocolate and it's pretty darn good. 

Always smiley faces that work here.
author: Manda Bear B.

description: Very disappointed with this place! It is waaaaay over priced for what you get! Not worth it! Service was all over the place! Won't be back! This is just a huge tourist trap
author: Anne-Marie R.

description: Wonderful food, horrible service. It took them 20 minutes to give me an ice cream cone and it was 9:30pm at night. Not busy at all. Just 4 servers working very slowly.
author: Kathia S.

description:
Great ice cream and free chocolate when you walk through the door!
Had a chocolate chip cookie sundae and my girl had two scoops of chocolate chip and gharadelli chocolate ice cream.
Decent price for around there too.
Fast friendly service.
author: J D.

description: We came in search of an ice cream sundae.  Very expensive for what appears at first to be very large, but in fact is about an average size.  If you check in with Yelp, you get 1.00 off.  The give you a free sample of chocolate when you walk in, and if you want, you can ask for a different flavor.   The ice cream was good, however the "hot fudge" solidified and it was really hard to eat.
author: Randi M.

description: Definitely great, quite on the pricey side. Took an order to go, pretty little compared to the amount you'd get while dining inside.
author: Disha B.

description:
I was here twice a few years back and I was not too pleased about just on everything at the (at that time) new location. Therefore I was not daring enough to type a negative review on a sweet San Francisco institution and hopefully wait for improvements.

On the other hand, I do like this newer location much better than the touristy original location in Fishermen's Wharf/Ghirardelli Square. The new location is quieter and less crowded at night. As many of you know, Downtown Market Street/Union Square is also a busy corridor too.

On my return back, I have redeemed myself and ordered the Presidio Passion Sundae to end my weekend.  For $9.95 + tax, I get a scoop of vanilla and chocolate ice creams, chocolate fudge and chopped strawberries with a cloud of whipped cream and a large chocolate-covered strawberry topping in a tall glass cup. This treat is made to perfection by the workers and all the ingredients incorporated very well. I also liked the chocolate-covered strawberry topping as the "cherry on top". This sundae is best way to end my Sunday!

As many of you have read from my "Quick Tip", if you check in with your phone, you will get $1.00 off your sundae. And with the shop's various sundaes, the check in offer does help. 

With all the changes including personnel, the new shop has finally got it all together did well to satisfy my return.
author: Matt G.

description: Came in like 11:00 pm at night with a few friends for some late night ice cream run. Nothing around here was open late aside from this place and it was delicious. There are two entrances for this location one through the inside of a hotel and one through the corner of the building to the main street. If you would like water it is self-serve. As you walk in one of the employees will greet you and give you a sample of chocolate. After you enter you can see the selections of chocolate for sale. Also, if you are in the mood for ice cream check out their menu! It's full of wonderful selections. Pay at the front and they'll give you a number to place on your table. You can pick wherever you want to sit. Ice cream can get messy so grab a ton of napkin! Also note the ice cream prices are a bit expensive, but the portions is huge! I had to share my treasure island dessert with a friend! Overall, will come back when I am in the area and craving ice cream! I highly recommend people to check this place out especially if you don't want to travel far for ice cream if you are in he area.
author: Danika P.

description: Ghirardelli is a very cute and convenient place. Our family enjoyed the complimentary chocolates which was received as soon as you walked in the shop.  The chocolate in which we received was the seasonal peppermint bark. The staff was kind but the actual service was a little slow. The portions of the ice cream was huge and very heavy. Although it was filling, the ice cream was truly delicious! The peppermint hot chocolate which we bought the next day was very yummy and had lovely flavours. All the prices are a little expensive but it's worth it. I definitely recommend visiting their whole your in San Francisco.
author: Maheen C.

description:
2016 Yelp 100 Challenge Review #19

I settled in on the Ocean Beach Sea Salt Caramel Sundae and it was indeed very good but I just felt the price point was too steep.  I was visiting San Fran and so I splurged and wanted to say I came here and tried it.  They give free chocolate samples when you come in which is nice.  Customer service was basic at best.
author: Steffanie B.

description: Walked 1.7 miles to get the hit chocolate i was craving. Reached 10:11PM, 19 minutes before closing, and was turned away, saying they have some meeting and can't make me a hot chocolate. Meanwhile a half dozen people sat inside enjoying their sundaes and shakes, while I looked on. Biggest disappointment so far this holiday season. Ghirardelli: it would help to post modified hours on your door.
author: Anoop G.

description:
Very nice ice cream shop inside the Palace Hotel on Market Street.  We walked in on an early sunday afternoon, were greeted with a worker giving free samples of chocolate squares.  There were plenty of places to sit, we ordered and it came to our table in less than 5 min.  
Only 3 stars because the Sundaes are $9.95 ea - which I think is pricey - and the butterscotch topping was wayyyy too sugary sweet.  And they're not that big.  They look big in the photos but just remember it's thick glass.
author: David S.

description:
If you want the biggest party in your mouth then this place is for you! (don't take this out of context lol)

I honestly like Dove and Godiva better than Ghirardelli but this place is pretty darn good. I forgot what I had but that doesn't matter because it was sugar/fat/ junk heaven.
The minute you walk into this place it smells like you gained 5 pounds haha.
If you are on a diet it's still worth going to!
The only thing from 5 stars is that it's just a little bit pricey and tasted almost too rich for me. 

Hope that helps.
author: Eugene P.

description: This is a classic go to spot in San Francisco and so many of my friends raved about it. My friend and I decided to go here for dessert after grabbing a quick bite to eat at the fisherman's wharf. It was amazing! The service was super quick and efficient, and they brought our sundae to our table. We decided to share the sea salt sundae and it tasted so amazing! Words cannot even describe. The sea salt caramel was the perfect balance of salty and sweet. I would definitely go back here!
author: Navya K.

description:
It's iconic...you almost HAVE to come to Ghiradellis when you're in SF, right?

You will be greeted by someone offering a fee sample and that's pretty cool, but you better bring your wallet if you order anything.  

A chocolate chip cookie and hot fudge sundae is gonna run you about 17 bucks, without tip.

Both are mediocre if you ask me, but they must be doing something right cuz they are hugely successful in spite of my opinion about their brand.
author: Lucky S.

description: I hide out here after the Golden Gate half for a short period to stay warm, sipping a matcha tea and eating a warm chocolate chip cookie. They gave me free samples of chocolate & were very accommodating with friendly customer service.
author: Kristen K.

description: Great freshly made waffle cones and chocolate lovers dessert paradise!  Was pretty crowded for after 900pm, but didnt have to wait more than 10 minutes from ordering, paying and receiving order.  I really enjoyed the Black Cherry Vanilla flavor in my waffle cone.
author: Chip H.

description:
You can't go wrong with ghirardellis when in SF! Very clean with plenty of seating. We were greeted right away when we walked in and were given a sample of the dark blueberry chocolate. We settled on a salted caramel brownie sundae ($1 off with Yelp check in) which came out to be about $15. We were given a number and the sundae was brought out to us.

The sundae had two soft brownies, they were good but I'd say they were more cake like. Either way, we devoured them quickly. Usually brownies with ice cream tend to get rock hard but these didn't. The sundae had two scoops of ice cream, hot fudge, caramel, whip cream and sea salt. You can never go wrong with caramel and sea salt BUT I'd recommend getting sea salt on the side. It was unevenly distributed on the brownie so we got a mouthfuls of salt. We tried scraping some salt off but it didn't help much. One sundae was good for three of us to share.
author: Jennifer T.

description: I just love this place. My favorite Ghirardelli location. Great old-school service and not too touristy. I love to come here and order a custom sundae. This is a fantastic way to treat yourself after being good for a while. Probably my favorite restaurant in all of San Francisco. Try the "Lands End" sundae, if it is your first time to the shop.
author: Joseph B.

description: Just another over priced ice cream shop. $12 for a simple sundae seems par for the course in SF but the service lacked a bit. Somewhat dirty and the exterior is riddled with street peddlers.
author: Dr D.

description: Very tasty. This isn't the main touristy location, it is in the heart of the financial district and honestly - that was ok by me. We stayed a few blocks away and was thrilled to find this place. They offer you a full-size Ghirardelli square when you first walk in - which is a nice greeting. I had a fudge sundae in a waffle cone and my husband has a caramel milkshake. We were both pleased.
author: Jessie C.

description: Better than the actual Ghiradelli shop because it's not where all the tourists go. Lots of chocolately options and free samples when you walk in. It's in the Palace hotel which is always really pretty and well decorated.
author: Kelly G.

description: This place is absolutely awful! I got the "famous" sundae and the ice cream and chocolate fudge basically had no flavor. A sundae at McDonald's for $1.29 far surpasses the low quality, tasteless crap, they call "ice cream."
author: Erika P.

description: So good- got the cookie dough sundae and shared it with my husband. It big enough for 2 to enjoy. The area has a lot of homeless so you have to get the code to use the bathroom- I guess that helps it stay pretty clean.
author: Linda E.

description: Not only is the chocolate delicious...but the staff member who stood in the doorway and greeted everyone was awesome! Great customer service, very courteous.
