You can have any type of delicious ice cream treat here and they have a menu of fabulous sundaes! It was very busy when we stopped off after a Giants game but it didn't take long to get our treats.
author: Sheila M.

description: Yummy ice cream.  A lot of seating indoor and outdoor.  Parking is a little rough but what isn't in San Francisco. A must stop with the family when visiting.
author: Mo R.

description:
I was originally looking for the creme brûlée cart, and my navigation said it was right in front of me  oh well, needed to get this sweet tooth craving fixed so ended up at the Ghirardelli square. 

It was my first time at this location and its smaller than the one near the pier. But it was definitely really cute. They were giving away blueberry dark chocolate, i'm not really a fan of dark chocolate so it was just okay for me. 

Ended up with the worlds most famous hot fudge sundae with chocolate and espresso with espresso chips, and that's definitely always a HIT! 

The staff was super friendly and supervisor, I forgot her name gave me a free waffle cone. She's so sweet! 

Oh and don't forget to check in so you can unlock your $1 off for a sundae!
author: Kathy B.

description: I went in here last night for a quick ice cream. 1 cashier, the line was to the door. 1 person making ice cream orders. Lots of people in Ghirardelli clothes walking around doing stuff but not really helping customers in this respect. I can't believe that it took 30 min from the time I walked in to get a small ice cream in a cup. I guess more, I can't believe I waited this long. Pretty poor customer service if you ask me.
author: Sean G.

description:
When you're walking down Market and you can no longer feel your hands from the freezing cold, it's time for a hot cocoa (because sometimes gloves are just too practical). 

It's easy to hop into this place since it's a pretty good size with minimal crowds. They rotate through different mini samples that they pass out at the door and lucky for me, they still had peppermint going for the holidays. 

Most of the merchandise is on the left side of the shop and the seating is on the right, all underneath a really incredible panorama of the city. Who doesn't like views with their dessert? As we stood in the very short line, we saw a whopping sundae being shared by a family of four - you definitely get what you pay for here. I stuck with a sea salt caramel hot chocolate with extra whipped cream, which was heaven. Maybe I'm not a local, but this place isn't just for tourists! I'd be replacing Starbucks with this stuff in an instant.
author: Kate K.

description:
Holy cow!  I went in to give the maid some time to make my room up. This was in the hotel and I had a little bit of a sweet tooth. 

I ordered a small chocolate shake, based on a friend's recommendation. This was by far the richest shake I have ever had. Not as thick as I might like, but I was more than happy with it. Honestly I could not have finished a larger size. Goooooooood stuff!
author: Mike Z.

description:
This is the largest of the Ghirardelli stores/ice cream shops. Often when the Original Ghiradelli store has lines out the door you can walk right in an order at this shop. 

You can watch chocolate in many different shapes being made right up front in the store. and there are quite a few more retail options in this store. 

They have the same menu as the other locations, last visit I ordered the Lands End - Salted Caramel Brownie Sundae. So much better than the regular brownie sundae, seriously. 

I do wish they would get new dishes, they dont seem to contain the ice cream very well and since they are metal they slide around a ton on the stone table surface.
author: Javi Alexa A.

description: Great location! Busy as always but it's so good it's worth it! Had a vanilla shake with Chocolate chips after a busy day of shopping and walking.
author: Paulina C.

description: Honestly this place was pretty mediocre and I wasn't impressed. I got the sundae that had marshmallow and hot fudge on it. The hot fudge wasn't even melted or hot (it was as if it wasn't heated up at all and just a thick fudge) the ice cream itself wasn't special either, basically what you get at a grocery store and I couldn't find any marshmallow in my sundae. I think this place was really hyped up for me to be so unimpressed which sucked cuz I was looking forward to it
author: Lauren K.

description:
Came here with a friend who was visiting from
out of town, as a part of the whole tourist experience. We shared the world famous hot fudge sundae. I'm not usually a fan of hot fudge, but the sundae was delicious! All of the other sundaes looked great as well. A little on pricey side, but definitely worth the visit.
author: Gina P.

description: The Hot Chocolate is amazing!! Choosing a sundae was one of the most difficult options I had during my vacation. Overall the experience was great, the sundae and ice cream were delicious . the only reason why I am not giving 5 stars is because for what you get it is kind of expensive however it is San Francisco so it has to be expected
author: Taylor F.

description:
I was strolling around for a store selling chocolate, ice cream, milkshake and other confectionary items. After a burrito bowl at Chipotle, I decided to come in for a sweet treat. Ghirardelli chocolates and desserts are the best way to satisfy that sweet tooth.

I came in looked around and checked out the menu. Next moment, I ordered the Vanilla and Chocolate Flavored Ice Cream in a Sugar Cone. It is delicious and I absolutely enjoyed it.

This is one of the best chocolate shops I have been to. It wasn't too busy either which is a good thing. They are in the lobby level of The Palace Hotel making it a perfect confection spot for everyone.

Positive first experience here so I'll definitely have to come back to try other items.

- Friendly staff members (+1)
- Good service (+2)
- Clean facility (+2)
author: Bennett W.

description: not like omg nom nom must pay extra bucks for but a nice sweet dessert
author: Vicky T.

description: Great hot chocolate with my wife. We live stopping here whenever we are in San Francisco. Always clean and really cool to watch chocolate being made. A must see in the city, stop by and enjoy an amazing Sundae.
author: J T.

description: Same recipe as all of the others. Superb  ice cream sundaes as always. We have two minor complaints. One being the employee Tristan who had major attitude the entire time we ordered especially when we asked him if all of the locations had the same Christmas tree ornaments which was displayed on the counter. The other complaint is the cleanliness of the restroom. Gross!
author: Dennis D.

description: I'm surprised this place has as many stars as it does. Last night we had a horrible experience and it wasn't just us. The line to order was out the door and everyone was miserable waiting between 30minutes and ONE HOUR for their ICE CREAM. Orders were delivered wrong MULTIPLE TIMES. One guy had to tell the staff what was on one of their signature sundaes because when they gave it to him it was missing the right toppings. My sister and I ordered one scoop of ice cream and it took 45 minutes. They are clearly understaffed, disorganized and poorly managed. I felt bad for them because it did not seem like a fun work environment. It was awful.
author: Alexis A.

description: Pretty good ice cream but a bit overpriced. The chocolate fudge is really good. Look to spend over $10 for an ice cream sundae here. If you like chocolate this is a pretty good place. Otherwise it's pretty average for ice cream.
author: Jane W.

description: Chilly day in the city? No problem! Warm up to a cup of hot chocolate, served in-house or to-go! It's smooth, with just the right level of sweetness and a dollop of whip cream on top! Though tasty, was it the best cup of hot chocolate I ever had? It's certainly better than most, but nothing earth shattering (for that, you need to go to La Maison du Chocolat in NY). 3.5 stars and thanks for the sample mini chocolate when I walked in! Much appreciated.
author: Chase B.

description:
So happy we went to this one instead of the one in Ghirardelli Square! Same menu, but about a million times faster cause there was barely any line.

Service was very nice and friendly. It was nice sitting by the window and people watching.

Got the Crissy Fields (cookie bits sundae), which was okay. I shared with a friend and we couldn't finish it, even though it doesn't look very big! The dark chocolate they put in the ice cream did not taste very good/didn't go well with the cookies 'n cream/vanilla ice cream, which was weird. I liked the cookie bits, they were quite crunchy!
author: Connie F.

description:
CHOCOLATE HEAVEN!!!

This location is at the busy Financial District on Market Street. Not only the retail portion but also the restaurant. That is right~ It is ice-cream time!!!

The moment we walked in.... FREE SAMPLE!! Friendly staff standing at the door giving out free sample, what a great way to greet the customers~

Love it when we could get assorted flavor of chocolate (our choice) in a bag. They have great sales promotion and that definitely motivate customers (ME) to buy more chocolate!!
author: Cassandra Y.

description:
I came here and ordered a Brownie Sundae. It was pretty expensive at around $15 after tax, but it was a lot - too much for 2 people to finish. 

Also, the spoons we got were sticky.

If I were to come back again, I'd order something smaller.
author: Guorui W.

description:
Tried some nob hill chill.Loved it.The caramel at the bottom is the cherry on the cake.Lip smacking!

Also tried some caramel flavored quake drink and loved it.
author: Priyanka L.

description:
Such a cool place to hang out! The store is fairly big in size thanks to their eating area. 

All of the workers were very friendly and helpful throughout our chocolate buying experience. Once we walked through the front door we were welcomed by a greeter who gave us free chocolate! FREE CHOCOLATE! Who doesn't love that! 

Walking around the area you can see a couple of chocolate makers do their magic and provide you with samples of what they just mad. The endless options of chocolate gift bags, tins, and create your own was overwhelmingly welcomed! 

The reason for the four stars is simple, at the "sundae bar" you can't see a thing! If you go to the bar to watch the people make ice cream and shakes you can't see anything because your seats are low and there is just tons of equipment blocking the magic. When I hear bar, I think "open" not a leg with a couple chairs.....



P.s left with $50 in chocolate and had a sundae UFFFFFFF love!
author: Marc P.

description:
Came in and instantly got a mini chocolate sample from a greeter at the door. Menus were stacked on a stand right in front and thankfully, lines were short (I came around 6pm) so I was able to step right up. 

I'm a huge sucker for brownie sundaes so seeing it on the menu was a dream come true! It helped that the picture for the sundae looked impossibly delicious. Even better? The sundae actually came out looking like its picture! The brownie wasn't as warm as I had hoped but ice cream was delicious and everything worked together perfectly without being insanely sweet. 

This was an amazing treat after a long day of facing adult responsibilities, even for a girl that doesn't have much of a sweet tooth!
author: Lani C.

description:
In the mood for a sundae? Look no further! Yes, it's a total tourist trap, but it's a dang tasty one. Sometimes, nothing but Ghirardelli hot fudge will do. 

That being said, be warned that the specials (the entire front of the menu) are HUGE. I shared two of them with two hungry guys, and we still didn't manage to finish them. One would have been enough for the three of us (and we all love desserts). But dang, they were good. We got:

1) The Lands End Salted Caramel Brownie Sundae. This was awesome; it has everything I look for in a sundae, PLUS Ghirardelli brownies, which are the best. Win.

2) The Chrissy Field Cookie Bits Sundae. Not as good as the Lands End. The cookie dough ice cream was great, but the crumbled cookies on top made the texture of the fudge really weird, and the dark chocolate squares were totally overwhelmed by the rest of the sundae. 

(Honestly, what we should have done was gotten the Lands End, but with cookie dough ice cream instead of vanilla.)

I also had a salted caramel hot chocolate, which was delicious at first (loved the caramel sugar on the whipped cream), but I think a lot of the salt sank to the bottom, so when I had finished about half of it, it just became super salty and undrinkable. Or maybe I was just ridiculously full from the sundaes. 

This place is the definition of indulgence, but sometimes that's just what you're looking for.
author: Liz F.

description: "A taste of Ghiradelli in the Financial District". The sweet shop that hits the spot. Whenever I am in the Financial District of San Francisco, I visit this place. If you can't get to Ghiradelli Square, this will suffice. They have ice cream, they have candy and the servers are just adorable! Are you craving a hot fudge sundae? No more worries because this is your place! It's right on the corner of Market & New Montgomery. You can build your own sundae or you can order one of their specialized menu items. If you are looking for candy to bring home to friends from your trip, you are in luck! Yummy Ghiradelli specialty chocolates can be purchased here as well!
author: Rebecca W.

description: Delicious ice cream for a classic confection company. It was a great way to start off our trip to San Francisco on the first day. The place is chock-full of chocolates and ice cream. Just beware of the gigantic ice cream scoops they give you. And you can always grab some chocolate if you feel like it.
author: Elliot F.

description:
This restaurant has hired some staff that does not seem to behave well with its international  customers, especially asians
..a sampler guy named Frederick initially refused to give a sample...later he dropped a chocolate bar on the floor near his feet and told my father in law that it was his sample! My father in law is a highly respected individual and doesnt deserve this. ...this is outrageous  racism.. .however the area manager Mr. Kroma remedied the situation by offering a complementary gift and made the employee Apologize ...highly unhappy with the situation but happy with the manager for his action..
author: Vivek R.

description:
It is not quite the same as going to the original location but it will do in a pinch.  The Land's End sundae was delicious.  The brownies are amazing.  It is pretty much the quintessential sundae.  It's not cheap but it is one of the best ones I have had in a while.  

They sell the small pieces of chocolate by the pound but it's not really by the pound because the minimum you can purchase is half a pound.  This was a strange interaction with the cashier and what seems like a pretty silly rule.
author: Sheryl C.

description: Nice shop but don't go there too late at night, homeless wandering around
author: Wangshu S.

description: Well-located branch version of the original Ghirardelli has substantially less seating, but all of the products. We were there about 8 p.m. tonight. The unisex restroom was a biohazard; the floor and toilet were a mess. The staff should have been much more attentive to this.
author: Scott N.

description:
Okay, so I've come to this place twice the first time was in March and the second time was this morning. 

REASON FOR ICE CREAM BREAKFAST:
This morning.. was a complete accident. My friend and I had to catch a noon flight going back to LA and we didn't realize most of the dim sum places were closed.. Me, being Chinese knows that traditionally Dim Sum places are supposed to be open earlier in the morning for a breakfast/brunch meal! So I am very disappointed in you SF Chinatown! You shame the dynasty! :P 

THE CRISSY FIELD: 
Anyways, interestingly enough the store that was open was this sweets shop and out of my friends brilliant idea was to eat ice cream first thing in the morning, like a five year olds dream and a 90 year old diabetic's nightmare. We ate the crissy field three scoops of cookies and cream ice cream with a soft baked cookie throughout the ice cream. With a ton of whipped cream all over, with cookie crumbles all on top and two dark chocolate Ghirradeli's to top it allll off. 

It is very RICH and CREAMY. Very heavy, I deifnitely could never finish this on my own. The first time I had the Brownie Sundae with a friend and we couldn't finish it. 

LOCATION: 
In the heart of DTSF, on the corner just off of the Montgomery Bart station :)
author: Tiffany J.

description:
This Ghirardelli shop is a super cute place for an after dinner treat, date night, or just because you want something sweet.

We were greeted immediately upon walking in and offered samples of their sea salt caramel chocolate (which was delicious... but then again, sea salt caramel is one of my favorite flavors).  You order in the front and your items are delivered to you.  All of the desserts are reasonably priced from around $8-12.

In addition to desserts, they also sell shakes, coffee, tea, chocolates, and baking products.  We ordered the banana split and both devoured it!
author: Annie P.

description: I love this place! Customer service is great and I just can't stay away from the chocolate cookie!
author: Dee J.

description: Good ice cream, we ordered the raspberry sherbet and banana split, both are good. The only complaint that I have is there's only 1 bathroom and we had to wait a long time to use it and smells really bad. Come on Ghirardelli, for the price of your ice cream, at least clean up your bathroom and add more bathrooms please. Ice cream came really fast and the server was nice. Kudos for that
author: Royeni T.

description:
There are so few touristic things in SF that locals will do unless dragged there by visiting friends and family: Pier 39, walking across the GG Bridge in the wind-whipped summertime and sundaes at the original Ghirardelli Square (preferring the lines at Mitchells or Bi-rite.)

But this corner oasis at the Sheraton Palace makes Ghirardelli sundaes so civilized and worth it, even for a local (or in my case, a returning local.)

I'm surprised how good these gigantic sundaes are  --old school good, from the intense chocolate fudge to the fresh whipped creme with a cherry on top.  I recommend the Brownie Sundae or the Butterscotch (thank goodness they are bringing back Butterscotch, which has bled fans for years thanks to the hugely popular salted carmel.) Hey even salted carmel fans have a sundae here too, so no hard feelings, although there is something fairly disappointing and disarming about salt on my whipped cream that makes me sure this is one I will not order twice.

This newer location at Market and New Montgomery has that classic soda shop feel, along with colorful, hyped up modern marketing. Importantly, its got a low key feel and no pushing crowds.  There is the steep cost of $9 per sundae, so there's that, but these are some very large, decadent old school sundaes.

I'm going to say it: this tourist spot has many delicious and redeeming qualities.  Self respecting San Franciscans can enter with their held high.
author: Rachel H.

description: Awesome! Kids love the shakes chocolates , late nights with friendz or just a stop over with family . Wonderful place
author: Sonia J.

description: What is lacking in this place is the "specialness" of going out for a chocolate and ice-cream treat.  There is no separation from the throng coming in-and-out, the oh-so-long line, the barking of names when orders are ready, and the signs that the place is well-used - dirty surfaces and all.  There is such a thing as being too popular, so the impact of the fans swarming to this place overwhelms the chocolate and ice cream.  It comes down to the reason for coming to this place.  If one looks to satisfy a craving, then this place does the job well.  If wanting to share a blissful moment with someone over a sweet treat, then this place is deflating.
author: Jay C.

description: We went to the Sundae Bar on Ghirardelli Square.  I ordered the "World Famous Hot Fudge Sundae."  The ice cream tasted terrible.  It tasted more like ice milk than ice cream.   There was so little chocolate fudge I could hardly taste it and it was cold not hot.   It cost $11.95.  I was terribly disappointed.
author: Michael P.

description: The atmosphere was great when you walked in and we were greeted with a chocolate sample.  It was busy and we had to wait for 30 minutes to get our ice creams.  The ice cream was delicious, but it was served in a tiny plastic cup and cost $12. I could have bought better ice cream in a grocery store.
author: John B.

description: I have visited the store on numerous occasions to purchase treats for others and myself.  The fare is of course good Ghirardelli chocolates.  They are always fresh and of course delicious.  The also usually have sales where you can get reasonable deals,
author: George W.

description: Ice cream is actually Dreyers, but the chocolate is good. Pretty much a normal sundae, good food though.
author: Ryan B.

description: This is the best chocolate store that sells the best chocolates in the world. Best chocolate shop you will ever encounter... without a doubt.  I recommend drinking a hot chocolate, since it is made there instead of heating up water and mixing it with cocoa
author: Adrián B.

description: Expensive but quite an experience!! We were there on Black Friday and it was packed! They were handing out free samples which we really enjoyed.
author: Brandi K.

description: Busy Saturday night but service was on point. Great ice cream and fantastic chocolate are second to none.
author: Remo T.

description: The Golden Gate banana split wasn't anything special but the Treasure Island warm brownie sundae is a must. The brownie is warm so it ends up melting the ice cream faster than I can eat it so me and my bf just share one, that's if he's willing to share that day lol
author: Wendy N.

description: Alright so the brodie and i had left the carnaval fest and needed some drinks. Every drink shop that we stopped by was closed until there was a ghirardelli in sight. Decided to get two drinks which ended up to be close to $20. Deeeyyum but it was totally worth the wait! The drinks bomb af and will definitely be coming back here on another occasion. Just what we needed after a long day.
author: Luis M.

description:
Mother and I went in on a Friday night and though it was quite busy, there was a person who greeted us right as we stepped in and handed us each a sample of their chocolate minis. We decided to order a scoop of their ghirardelli chocolate ice cream in a waffle bowl to share. Though the total came out to around $7 (quite expensive for ice cream) it was absolutely delicious! The chocolate ice cream was rich, but wasn't too sweet so we were able to finish it without water. Wish they had a plain waffle bowl as their chocolate dipped waffle bowl is way too sweet! 

Remember to check-in on yelp for $1 off an ice cream sundae. Keep your receipt for 10% off your entire purchase the next time you come in, though the 10% discount may not be used together with the yelp check-in offer.
author: Kristi T.

description: We ordered Haight Ashberry Sundae because it had free sunglasses and flower crown. It tasted ordinary. Nothing special about it. But hey, they gave away free sunglasses and flower crown.
author: Leanna C.

description:
- overpriced
- overcrowding tables 
- dirty tables 
- price 

+ service 
+ restroom was clean 
+ rich and decadent Salted Caramel Sundae
+ portion size 
+ speed 
+ local business (founded in 1852)
+ they control every aspect of its production 
+ they reject almost half of cocoa seeds, only wanting the highest quality ones

My daughter is big on caramel, not me but I wasn't going to spend $30 on ice cream so I can order my own. We shared a salted caramel sundae and I got Gavin a scoop of chocolate. 

I don't need to write anymore. Simply look at my picture of the sundae. It was so creamy and rich. I loved it. My son finished his scoop and asked for more.
author: Tram N.

description:
Very clean, tourist friendly. Pricey, though I knew it wasn't going to be cheap. The line was out the door. 
The sundae was sooo good. So creamy and rich in flavor. The hot cocoa was a bit too sweet for me. I couldn't finish it. 

We did get a free sundae though because they made one too many. Yaay

There wasn't much seats. We had to wait about 10 min to get a table.
author: Aubrey H.

description:
I know that this place is going through renovations...the line is insane!!  Once you order, explore the place.  Great place to take kids. 

Love their deserts.  Highly recommend going to the Palace Hotel location if you don't want to wait.   The staff there offers you a chocolate treat as you walk in.
author: S. C.

description: After giving a talk at a conference nearby, it was recommended that I treat myself at this ice cream shop. I came around 4:30pm on a Thursday, and while relatively busy, there were plenty of seats/tables open. I ordered the salted caramel brownie sundae ($14.50) and a vanilla latte ($5.95). The sundae was absolutely gorgeous and delicious, but I was defeated about 1/4-1/3 in, so bring a few friends with you! The latte was also made well, and I was a fan. In addition to brownie sundaes, they also serve regular sundaes, sorbet, ice cream scoops and cones, shakes and floats, hot chocolate, and other types of tea/coffee. The price of their sundaes is definitely a bit higher than I expected, but it would be very difficult for one person to finish it, and worth it as a "treat yoself" moment. There is also plenty of chocolate in their gift shop- I bought a few gifts (including a SanFran-themed chocolate box) for friends, but they also had their square chocolate in every flavor. While waiting in line to order, I was also given a free square of chocolate, which made me happy. Overall, I'm really glad I tried this place- it was fun!
author: Lisa S.

description: Really friendly service. The ice cream is so good.  Free samples help take the bite out of the expensive prices.  But it's SF - everything is expensive.  It is super delicious too.
author: B Dale D.

description: Old fashioned ice cream sundae done right.  Yes, I'm a fan! Great ice cream, fresh ingredients, clean store, and friendly staff - what's not to like.  Even with all the people (i.e., tourists) coming here, you're still able to get your order without too long of a wait.  I definitely recommend Ghirardelli for a good treat.
author: Ken S.

description: I've definitely had better ice cream at other places. It is a cute little shop though, and a nice place for tourists to rest and buy some chocolate. But I honestly wouldn't come here if I was craving ice cream--there are just so many better options.
author: Stephanie L.

description: Easily the best Banana Split I've ever had. Great atmosphere, friendly staff, and big portions. One Banana Split is easily enough for two people. Can't wait to come again and try the World Famous Chocolate Sundae.
author: Damian M.

description:
Came here on my way to the Giants game. It was right at the top of the BART entrance on Montgomery. My wife and I got milk shakes and people watched as we indulged. The shakes were delicious. The price was high!
The overall atmosphere of the place was pleasant with normal noise.
author: Patrick Z.

description: It was just okay and not as well as I thought. That will be great If they could make sundaes looks better. Anyway, I like the chocolate.
author: Nina N.

description: A must have if your in the area. Prices are decent considering it is SF and the service was quick. Will definitely return if I'm in the area again!!!!
author: Wesley S.

description: This place just never disappoints. Everyone has always been super friendly every time I've gone. And it's always delicious and a fun treat. Yummy
author: Christopher J.

description:
Great chocolate is an understatement. We had a hot chocolate and an ice cream Sunday!!
Great service as well.
author: Kethnie M.

description:
I do love the fact that they're open until 10:30 on the weekdays and 11:30 on the weekends.
This place is definately a tourist trap. Unfortunately they do make the best hot chocolate.
It's a perfect treat for yourself at the end of the night.

This spot is packed with tourists during the day time, so I'd suggest anyone who wants to order something without a massive line to go during the evening.

Desserts are always better at night right?
author: Alui L.

description: got some delicious mlikshakes from here our last night in San fran and what deliciousness they were! also picked up some chocolates to bring home and hot chocolate mix for me :) expensive but worth it.
author: Crystal P.

description:
Warm greeter at the door who handed out samples of their signature chocolate squares and asked if we wanted to take a look at the menu!

I came with my working girls right after a long, middle of the week, Wednesday and 8 hour plus shift so we treated ourselves to some sweets!

Ice cream, sundaes, warm fudge and any types of chocolate filled goodness on the menu, Ghirardelli offers richness to any of their chocolate delights!

I do recommend their Salted Caramel Hot Chocolate Cocoa - http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=drb7f1iv9Rthn0aHg8WdcQ&userid=I-FmdvI28N7OIIt4JZOgIg

A bit of that sea salt balances out with that drizzled caramel decorated on top and that piping hot cocoa is great on a cold, foggy day in SF!  It surely warmed my body up and kept me quite content with the cold weather when we left and started to stroll down the streets!

Good dining area, great customer service and superb chocolate selections!  

Ghirardelli makes me feel like I'm welcomed, a great caffe shoppe where I can relax and splurge on chocolate fine dining!
author: Tiffany D.

description:
When you're craving dessert, Ghirardelli is the place to go. Everything on their menu will satisfy your craving & make you so happy afterwards!!! The only thing is that it's a bit overpriced. But once in a while, you deserve to get yourself a little something extra!

By the way, their cones are huge! Be sure to mentally prepare for a lot of happiness.
author: Alice H.

description: Come-on now, let's be honest this is the best ice cream place in the city.  You have a great view and you have the best chocolate ice cream in town. If you go to San Fran you have to stop by this landmark.
author: Joe T.

description: It's Ghirardelli! If you like chocolate then come here. If you like THEIR chocolate then really come here! Besides selling the normal chocolate bars they have in stores, they use them in their ice cream, shakes, and sundaes here. It's a chocolate lovers paradise. If you're in the area, it is worth a visit. I had to bring my wife here twice. Customer service was great and the establishment is clean!
author: Robb F.

description:
Awesome. Cannot come to San Francisco and not get a hot fudge sundae at Ghiradelli's!
This location serves ice cream and coffee and has a candy section.
Cashier was super friendly and pleasant. Double confirmed our order which was served up in minutes.
Highly recommend if you are nearby and need a bit of sweetness.
author: David S.

description: Wanted a mint shake, got a brown liquidy shake with the chips blended to a powder... I saw the guy really struggling making the shake. I have worked in an ice cream store before, made plenty of shakes and it's all about knowing the right proportions. This guy had no idea. Put in like 5 huge scoops for a small, and a little milk, so then he had to keep putting in milk and extra ice cream about 3+ times. Sadness for $7+ :(
author: Celine S.

description:
Oh golly, I feel like I should call Eddie Haskell and Lumpy Rutherford and cruise chicks like Mary Ellen Rogers before the Beaver ruins everything with his shenanigans. Then I see it costs $6.95 for a Hot Fudge Sundae and think maybe I'm not really in the Eisenhower era after all. This new, fully loaded Ghirardelli location would seem to be in an ideal spot as it has the prime corner location in the Palace Hotel facing both Market and New Montgomery Streets. Jamie W. and I ventured in here after dinner since we wanted to see if it was a place we could hang out and tap on our iPads.

Well, there's no free WiFi, so what else could we do here? (tapping fingers)... Hmmm, I guess we could order a Hot Fudge Sundae with extra whipped cream and nuts (see photo). Well, we did and felt like we were going steady for the first time. OK, not really. We're just all-weather ice cream eaters if given our druthers about our dairy intake. Brain freeze... I'm better now. Looking around, it certainly offers a lot of space for like-minded dairy enthusiasts of which there were only two that night, lonely-looking people devouring their own sundaes with sad-eyed abandon.

I think you can find most of the sundaes available at the flagship operation in Ghirardelli Square, including that horrendous-sounding Earthquake, eight scoops of creamy decadence covered with eight equally decadent sauces. And there are enough bags of chocolate squares in there to feed a country the size of Montenegro. However, I'm not feeling that much electricity about the place, especially on a quiet, wintry weeknight when barely a soul could be found in search of a chocolate fix. Hate to say it, but I think Ghirardelli may have reached a saturation point with its burgeoning chain despite the lure of free samples.

ICE CREAM - 3 stars...hits the spot but there are calorific consequences to consider
AMBIANCE - 2.5 stars...expansive but unenergetic
SERVICE - 2.5 stars...borders on the unctuous
TOTAL - 3 stars...just one too many Ghirardelli shops if you ask me
author: Ed U.

description: Ummmm so this place was one of the only places actually open at 8 PM on a Saturday night. Thank God! My husband and I were craving something sweet after dinner and we found it at this magically delicious spot! We ordered he fudge ice cream sundae, hot chocolate and mint tea. Fabulous sundae...one of the best I've ever had and the hot chocolate was superb! Goodness, I would come here everyday but I would probably turn diabetic. Thank you so much for an amazing experience!
author: Darina H.

description:
What Happened?

I literally take my staff (10 +) from work here once a week for a TREAT 

Just this past Saturday (1/9) I did not know they made a shake called the Tenderloin 
This establishment had a pungent odor in the air (dry pee like smell) from the wet rag they were using to wipe the table. Literally the urine like smell added a sour flavor to my shake
Let me add the shortage in staff who made my shakes had sweat running down there face (oh my, extra salt to my sweet drink)

I would include some photos but I did not want to offend my viewers
author: Ryan R.

description:
Sipping chocolate on my way home!

I love having this place here. I don't know why its only filled with tourist though. I guess when you live in a Disneyland like city you over look the gems and this is one of them.

This is the best Salted Caramel Sundae on Earth.
author: Justin S.

description: It's really gone downhill. The glasses are dirty and sticky. The portion I got with my BROWNIE SUNDAE was like finger sized. When I complained to the server, he rolled his eyes and said it was a half brownie portion.  I think a half browie should be at least 2 inches this was one max. Plus, I think he rolled his eyes because he's gotten this complaint often enough. They didn't even offer a plate under everyone knows there will be spillage. Every empty table was not cleaned yet and it took a while for us to get our sundaes, the couple ahead of us were served and finished by the time we got ours. Not a good experience
author: Taurean F.

description:
Perhaps as a 40 year San Franciscan I'm jaded but increasingly I see a lot of moderate priced places with lesser quality and service than low priced places...

Today I met a new gal who came to the city to meet me.  With the holiday we had fewer choices than normal.  We were both late meeting for various reasons and she wanted to warm up so I simply headed to Ghiridelli's at 2 Montgomery street.

I consider the price high more like at the Wharf than for downtown... I wound up spending almost $30 for basically 2 brownies with ice cream and coffee for the gal and a medium shake for myself.

The service was exceptionally poor in my opinion - greeted at the door then left hanging.  It would appear you order at the counter near the door but don't -- you have to go to the back register. 

My medium shake was too dark and bitter for my taste.  I would have preferred the McDonald's $4 shake which tastes better and is not so dark.  For the price and quality I think it was too little and too tasteless.  I also resent them charging 10% sales tax including the 4% for healthcare.  If they take an order at the table and bring it to the table OK, but when you have to stand in line to order and only have a person slowly bring it to the table and set it down this does not merit in my opinion and additional 4% on the tab for people just doing their jobs.  Tell the cheapies at Ghiridelli to pay up for their employees health care your prices are high enough to cover it already.

If some dumbo just off the boat or just in from SFO thinks this is great welcome to suckerville San Francisco wants to fleece you.  I guess this works at the wharf but the real joke is on the tourists because real San Franciscans never go to the wharf.  My date is a native born San Franciscan and fairly pleased with her pile of chocolate but next time I'm taking her to Rainbow Grocery and getting her ten pounds of the stuff for the cost of the two brownies.

I rate our experience moderate at best to poor - one other point we were trying to talk to each other but it is too noisy to hear each other like so many places with hipsters and tourists invading them.

You can con the tourists but not the long time locals or natives...
author: Dalt W.

description: Hands down this best tasting chocolate and butterscotch out there!! It's a great way to end the trip to San Francisco after a Giants game before getting on the bart! Can't wait to stop there again! Staff is amazing no matter how busy they are you won't be waiting long!
author: Frank M.

description:
Some people have said I'm an "ice creamaholic" and I tend to agree with them.  That and my love for all things chocolate.  I've been enjoying the Original Ghirardelli Ice Cream Parlor at Ghirardelli Square for many years and always leave very content.  Noticed Ghirardelli opened an Ice Cream and Chocolate Shop near work and just had to go check it out.  Albeit it took me awhile, but been working some crazy hours, so decided to treat myself the best way I know how..................with ice cream.

Had to stick with my absolute favorite Hot Fudge Sundae and it brought back fond memories of going to Ghirardelli Square.  I received a $1 off discount when I checked into Yelp, so that was a bonus.  What a great way to end my day.
author: Lon H.

description: Absolutely delicious. Came by here on break to relieve some stress aka destroy an ice cream cone. The place has some construction going on around it, but it still is pretty clean inside. The girl behind the counter was nice and I ordered a vanilla ice cream in a waffle cone. I decided to sit down and eat it and just kinda take it all in. The place is kinda pricey ($6 for the ice cream), but the quality of the place makes up for it because the ice cream was absolutely perfect. I'll definitely come by here when I have a sweet tooth.
author: James R.

description:
Attention chocolate lovers, welcome to paradise.

Seriously, if you love chocolate you have to come to Ghirardelli's. The Ghirardelli square location is much better, plus it has a nice view of the bay and the Golden Gate. But if you can't make it, this is an excellent alternative.

The sundaes, ice cream and hot chocolate are fantastically decadent. My favorite is the triple chocolate ice cream.

As you would expect they have a wide selection of chocolate bars and gifts which you can also find in a couple thousand locations around town from the airport to Walgreens, but of course Ghirardelli's has more choices and products like the hot cocoa powder that you don't usually find elsewhere.

If you are going to get some bars, may I recommend the Evening dream 60% cacao?
author: Gerardo D.

description: Yes it is good but a little too sweet for my personal taste but it is more rich than other chocolate so it makes sense...a little expensive but you are paying for quality
author: Jo N.

description:
GHIRARDELLI is One of the BEST FOREVA in the city with its ultimate Sundaes anyone could die for. It never compromises on its standards anytime. If your planning to have an Icecream aft a HEAVY dinner, then SHARING works-coz it's too overwhelming to be finished by a single person . For once I don't want to review their icecreams coz everything is sooooo good there.
PS- Easy on the whip cream if you want more Icecream
author: Amu S.

description: Great ice cream, and lots of it!  Ghirardelli is a San Francisco tourist destination, but it is also great for locals looking for something sweet.  We tried the chilled cocoa float with mocha chip and vanilla ice cream.  The wait time was short, and the drink came out to us with two spoons and lots of whip cream.  My girlfriend and I got through most of it, though it was a little too big for the two of us to finish without getting a bellyache.  With tax, the bill came to $8.98.  Highly recommend for folks looking for a solid ice cream fix (and walk through the hotel after for some free live music and nice architecture).
author: Matthew R.C. Z.

description:
For anyone who loves chocolate, if you are in San Francisco, you should absolutely check out one of the several Ghirardelli Ice Cream & Chocolate Shops. 

Upon entering the shop customers are handed samples of the latest chocolates from Ghirardelli. Admittedly, there have been a few times when I've been walking to somewhere else in the area and I've just popped in quickly just to get a sample. Hopefully, if people are inspired to check out Ghirardelli based on my review, that will offset my sample thievery. 

As good as the free samples are, if you go in the shop, you would be remiss if you did not get one of their stupendous ice cream sundaes. Note: If you check in on Yelp, you get $1 off of a sundae. My favorite is the Treasure Island which features two warm, incredibly rich and decadent brownies served with two scoops of ice cream and a bevy of toppings including what is possibly the best chocolate syrup ever. The sundae's cost around $9 (even with the check in deal) but they are worth every penny. They are easily the best ice cream sundaes that I've ever had. To the tourists reading this, your trip to SF is incomplete without a stop at Ghirardelli.
author: Ravi S.

description:
HAVE AGAIN: the hot fudge sundae was delicious, but a bit steep at $11.95. A one scoop ($4.95) with hot fudge (+$1.25) and nuts (+$1.25) was a much better deal.
Service needed to be improved: no one handing out chocolate samples and it was unclear about how the ice cream would be served. But Yelp had $1 coupon which was good for both sundaes.
author: Keith R.

description:
First off, i love that they're open late. 

Came here last night after having dinner at a nearby restaurant; it was 10pm and the people still kept coming even after us. 

The servers was nice and friendly. Our sundae came quickly right after we ordered it. It was delicious, as with anything that has Ghirardelli chocolate. Would definitely come again if I had a late night sweet craving.
author: Robbie P.

description:
If you're going to go to Ghirardelli Square, or even San Francisco, this place is a must! I took my friend from out of state here after dinner and we had an absolutely wonderful time. We went on a Friday night, so yes, it was super busy and we were lucky to have been able to place our order in under 15 minutes and even be able to find a seat. we split the sea salt caramel sundae that ended up being $13 (did not expect it to be that expensive!) but it was so delicious and surpassed my expectations. 
As we were finishing our sundae, we were facing an Instagram captioner's block and just could not figure out a caption for our picture from the Square. We decided to ask a server, but when we asked, I don't believe he heard our question but just smiled at us. It was an incredibly busy night so we were stuck facing our blocks by ourselves. Nearly 10 minutes later, this same server came to us with the brownie sundae. I said, "we did not order this; you must have the wrong table!" He said "no I don't, it's for you." Though we were completely stuffed already, we still tried to enjoy some part of the brownie sundae. Such a kind, random act of kindness. It is servers like this that keep customers coming back. We didn't manage to grab his name, unfortunately, but what an amazing end to our Friday in the city!
author: Danyelle A.

description:
As I mentioned earlier, The Nephew #2 is in town. After we made arrangements as to where and when to meet up after our various SF expeditions, I spotted this Ghiradelli Ice Cream and Chocolate Shop location. Wow, they sure are everywhere, as Ed U. mentioned in his Yelp! review. I remember this location at New Montgomery and Market used to be a bespoke/custom shirt place. Bespoke shirts made-to-measure and order.

I was definitely in the mood for a hot fudge sundae even though I had lunch. When I walked in, I was ambushed with an offer of a Ghirardelli chocolate and caramel sample by a sales associate. I declined the offer and asked if they had any samples without caramel. Unfortunately, these were the only samples being offered that day. I then stated I was only stopping by for a hot fudge sundae. I was then directed to the till to place my order. 

When I got to the till, I inquired about the hot fudge sundae sizes to the young woman at the order terminal. She told me I could get either a one scoop or a two scoop. I opted for a one scoop. She then proceeded to explain taking the number to the table and that my order would be brought to me. Pretty cut and dry.

As soon as I selected a table and sat down, the ambushing sales associate brought me my hot fudge sundae. Wow, that was pretty fast. It was not crowded at all, not that busy, that's for sure. There were two tables already occupied and one person sitting at the window counter. It started to get a tad bit busier by the time I left. There were two women getting ready to sit down as I was leaving. I asked the sales associate now performing the role of server as to where to put my dirty dishes. He told me to leave it on the table.

Well, this one is A-OK. The service was all right. It just does not have the ambiance of the original Ghiradelli Ice Cream and Chocolate Shop in the Fishermen's Wharf area. With the chocolate being rolled back and forth and back and forth. . . .  If anything, it is like a Starbucks branch just about on every corner. A Ghiradelli Ice Cream and Chocolate Shop just about on every corner in San Francisco.  Hmm, that makes logical sense to me when I consider Ghiradelli chocolate is a San Francisco institution.

I am done here, time to go do some S-H-O-P-P-I-N-G (as in the title of the Pet Shop Boys song from their 1987 album titled ACTUALLY) before meeting up with The Nephew #2 to head for home.

https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=jR4h6yfqI-M

SYOY! Ciao!
author: Chiara A.

description:
Having been to the Ghirardelli factory in the marina, I know what the sundaes are supposed to be like and this was definitely sub-par. I got the cookie bits sundae, which is supposed to be smothered in hot fudge and there was only a tiny drizzle on one side of one of the three ice cream scoops. It was enough for ~1/4 scoop. The sundae tasted pretty bland without it, especially the vanilla scoop, since there weren't enough cookie pieces to flavor it without the fudge.

Also my friend ordered two scoops of ice cream and they only gave him one scoop. When he questioned them about it they said it was hidden in the waffle cone under the first scoop and he just couldn't see it. He was skeptical, but went ahead and ate through. Once he got to where the second flavor should be, it wasn't there. Thankfully he had gotten two flavors, so he was able to prove that they had only given half the order, but if he had gotten two scoops of the same flavor he wouldn't have been able to prove it and might have only gotten half the order.
author: Brennan R.

description:
So crowded and hot in there. You can buy the chocolates anywhere in town. So save yourself some time and money and do that if you are on vacation! Just go through to take a picture in front of the sign.
Also, FYI if you want a sundae go to the bottom ice cream shop Ghiradelli has (right by the steak restaurant). You will save yourself an hour of waiting time and it is the same menu!
We waiting in a 15 min line only to be told if you want a sundae you have to wait another 40 min in line. I just gave up because it was so warm in there :(
author: Vicky S.

description:
Great place to get a small, super sweet/rich snack. 

Employees are super friendly and they give you samples as you walk in!  

I bought 5 chocolate bars, but the best one was the Intense Dark Raspberry Radiance Bar.  It is one million percent worth the $5.  

I'll try the ice cream sundaes next time.
author: Kristin H.

description: Came here after dinner to grab ice cream. We had three orders of ice cream with SUGAR cone and were given the regular cones - that was very disappointing but that's what they called sugar cone because their other option was waffle. The ice cream was also a bit on the pricer side. It was near $15 bucks for three scoops and the ice cream wasn't anything exceptional. Should go here to order their specials like the sundaes etc. they sell a lot of chocolate all around the shop which really tempted me. There's also plenty of seats inside to eat your ice cream.
author: Amanda C.

description: Visit here if you must but nothing special. i can get the chocolate at my local grocery store.
author: Dan N.

description:
Is work stressing you out? Get some ice cream!

The portion sizes here are HUGE. The sundaes are a good size for two people to share. It's pricy, at almost $10 for a sundae, but might be worth it for a special occasion. A basic ice cream cone is $5 and is a much better size for one person. Yum.
author: Theresa M.

description:
Cute guy greeted me at the door and pointed me in the right direction. Grabbed a mocha for my friend and was in-and-out in under 4 minutes.

Expensive but (ostensibly) delicious (I didn't have it, my friend did).
author: Sean B.

description: I've stopped here many times during my visits for a morning mocha and the service is almost always fantastic. There's a girl there, I think her name is Alicia who absolutely rocks. She remembers me, even from months before and remembers my drink! She let me use my 10% coupon more than once during my vacation. She's always friendly and even gave me a discount when she could not find a drink punch card for me. I stopped in on the last day of my vacation and unfortunately she was not there. No one offered a chocolate, my coupon was refused as it is for chocolate, and when my drink was ready they just yelled to me that it was on the bar. Nevertheless, I will be back. Alicia makes up for the other lackluster employees. That girl deserves praise and a raise!
author: Nicole J.

description:
Sweet tooth heaven!

I was always told that Americans can't do chocolate and after a Hersey's experience was a little candid to try Ghirardelli's. Although wooed by the taster minis (milk chocolate caramel), that they hand out at the door in this branch, I was enticed to shared a muir woods sundae and a drinking chocolate. 

I am an absolute sucker for cherry ice cream and the hot chocolate sauce on the sundae was just divine.

The drinking chocolate was also pretty good. I've been a touch spoilt with hot chocolate in Europe (not England, where this tends to be atrocious - although we are getting an upsurge in cacao, which I am thoroughly enjoying), but was pleasantly surprised by this little cup of goodness. I wouldn't go out of my way to drink another, but I would for that sundae... And it did go some ways to dispel the myth and open me to the idea that Americans can make great chocolate on par, and even better than some European varieties.
author: Ray C.

description:
This place is always a go to place if you are in the city! 

Expect long lines as it is a tourist hot spot.  However, they try to keep you happy by providing complimentary chocolate. 

Once the line starts moving, it goes by fast.  I got the strawberry hot chocolate and it was delicious!  Seating can be hard to find so you have to do a bit of looking.  However, I greatly appreciate how they bring it right to your table.
author: Shiori S.

description:
I was disappointed that I was not able to make it to Ghirardelli Square for my ritual buying of my chocolate bars and to have a sweet treat.

With our luck, there was a Ghirardelli on our way back to Union Square and I had to stop. There are mini chocolate squares now available (maybe for diet people?) and we got free samples of it. Man, I wanted the regular sized one as a sample! DARN IT!!!

I ended up buying 5 chocolate bars to bring back home (Buy 4 get 1 Free Promo). It is only in SF that you can buy limited edition bars and various flavors.

This location also serves dessert!
author: Maria C.

description: It's always great to eat the ice cream sundae here. Too bad the Pasadena, CA location closed down a long time ago. I used to go there in high school.
author: Steve P.

description:
If by chance you're near-ish to the Embarcadero/Financial District and want to pick up a chocolate-themed gift (assuming that said gift can come in the form of chocolate squares or bars), this is the place. (It's also a full-scale ice cream shop, but I'm saving that experience for another day).

While it's fun to visit the historic Ghirardelli Square for the nostalgia, there's no need to go out of your way if you're primarily on a chocolate acquisition mission. Most (if not all) of the merchandise is the same there as it is here.

The best bet? Check out the clear, 80-count sacks of "overstock", available in several varieties (currently, $26.95 each). Shelf life is printed on the bottom of the bag, in case you don't plan on eating/giving the bag right away. Checking with the greeter at the door occasionally will tip you off to additional deals though too (...and they're usually armed with a basketful of samples, just in case you've forgotten why you came to the store...).

Note:
* Considering buying some chocolate (for later) and a sundae (for now)? Check the bottom of your receipt from the sundae purchase to see if a coupon for 10% off of a future purchase is included.

Coming back twice? Darn... you might just have to.
author: Dennis W.

description: Very delicious ice cream!!!. I recommend this place. I think it was a little pricy but is worth it.
author: Nasim S.

description:
I love ghirardelli as a local from the North Bay; however the service I got here seemed as though they wanted me out as soon as possible. I arrived 30 min. before closing so that should not have been the reason. I would much rather go to the location at Ghirardelli Square than this location. 

Ice cream however was delicious as usual. I got a scoop of strawberry and a scoop of cookies and cream. If you are fine with potentially poor service this is a good place to go.
author: Eric W.

description:
I figured this would be a tourist trap, overpriced and full of people. Well, nope! I was wrong. We were nicely offered pieces of chocolate as we walked in. The shop wasn't packed at all during an afternoon, which was nice!

The interior is quite nice with a counter/bar that looks like the ones you find in Europe & with a nice Ghirardelli Square panoramic picture above it.

We got ice-cream in waffle bowls & cones. They have some good flavors like Butter Pecan, Cookie Dough, Mint Chocolate Chip, Rocky Road. You can add hot fudge on top... Yum!

We ate inside the shop eyeing the chocolate covered nuts and other chocolates. :-D

If you're looking for San Francisco souvenirs, there's a good selection of gifts for people outside the city/state/country like Cable Cars with chocolates inside. All the Ghirardelli chocolates make good presents too! 

Cool SF spot. I recommend!
author: Leslie S.

description: I like this place, aside from the one by fisherman's wharf. It's less touristy and crowded and still serves the same sweet and filling goodness of fatty chocolaty creamy options. One ice cream sundae is worth a whole meal's full of calories or more. I'll come here again to buy chocolate as gifts for family or friends.
author: Alice S.

description: It's a complete chocolate shoppe just surprised to see lot of chocolate boxed so tempted to buy all the available boxes over there, and finally bought one assorted mixed chocolate box and took sample chocolate given by them. So planning to taste sundae ice creams over there.
author: Sandeep R.

description:
Stay away if you value your value healthy blood sugar levels and teeth. Upon entering, like any other Ghirardelli, you're treated to a complimentary piece of chocolate. This chocoholic's heaven is lined wall to wall with perfectly stacked, wrapped, and packaged containers of chocolate. Honestly, who knew that a company that produces only square pieces of chocolate would find so many ways to package their product? 

Anyways, I come here pretty much only for their house-made treats: ice cream and drinks. Pick up a menu near the check-out counter and feel free to peek at the tables of other sweet-toothed patrons along the way. There are plenty of seats here to sit and enjoy your dessert! Best part is since they offer coffee to the early risers, the rest of the shop is open early too for crack-of-dawn sugar emergencies. Bathroom requires an employee to unlock for you, a little annoying when you're in a rush or the employees are busy. Don't be afraid though - they're pretty friendly and can get the job done.

If you're here you probably already know what Ghirardelli chocolate is like - if not go ahead and take a bite of that freebie you got walking through the door. Yeah? Silky sweet. Okay, imagine that in ice cream/shake/hot chocolate form... Whatever you're thinking will be pretty accurate. You can never outgrow a good hot chocolate, but even the small size packs quite the diabetic-punch. I opt for the Sea Salt Caramel Hot Cocoa to try and get a little more balance, but the sea salt usually all ends up at the bottom so it's all in vain. Ice cream is oh-so-delicious, even on the coldest and windiest days. But their shakes? To die for. Get a Mint Quake Shake and you'll understand the meaning of #thestruggleisreal while waiting for the ice cream to melt enough so you can keep sipping.
author: Helen S.

description:
I never really was a fan of Ghirardelli... mainly because I'm not a big fan of chocolate. However my girlfriend kept insisting we have a late night dessert here for our last night in SF. 

Of course, we were given free chocolate upon entering (which is always nice!) and we ordered a sundae which came with cookies and cream ice cream, cookies bits, pieces of chocolate, whipped cream, and chocolate syrup! I wasn't really excited but then again, I haven't had a sundae in a while and I forgot how yummy they are. This sundae was AWESOME. What made it was the pieces of chocolate chip cookies in the sundae... that was the best part. Between 4 girls, we couldn't finish this sundae. It was a good way to end the night.
author: Felicia L.

description:
I love chocolate (If you ever read my reviews you would notice)! Always looking for a chocolate desert, or looking forward to Wednesday (which is my personal chocolate day). So yes! Of course I needed to head to a Ghirardelli shop during my time in San Francisco. If you know nothing about Ghirardelli (and you should) it's a chocolate brand division of the famous Swiss brand Lindt that is a SanFran local! 

I was welcomed with big smile (American costumer services nice as always), and a small sample of Dark Chocolate and Salt Caramel. OMG, I liked it!Ok, now I am ready for more. Bring down the ice cream deliciousness.  

My overall experience here was great, I have nothing to complain. Nice service, great product, the only shame is not having it back home. I guess I need to buy a bunch and bring back with me next time. Hummmmm Wednesdays will be happier with Ghirardelli for sure!
author: Fernanda S.

description:
Great ice cream and great costumer service!!!
The location is convenient and is in down town area.
Worth it to try:)
author: Darko G.

description: Thia ghiradelli is AIITE YANO AIITE. Its overpriced and wayyy to sweet. However if you want a place to get some chocolate souvenirs then you can come here. I like the caramel chocolates but thats it LOL. The dark chocolates are pretty bad no offense and the sundaes are MEH. Just go to godiva or something hahahaha
author: Jane K.

description: too much good stuff in here. especially the hot chocolate! mama and i ordered one each after dinner to keep us warm on a surprisingly brisk summer night walk. the store is not big, but, well positioned. friendly folks and lots of sample options. obviously, pretty pricey. but, we had to pick up a couple pieces for the kiddies. nice spot.
author: Rey L.

description: Nothing tastes better on a cold, windy San Francisco afternoon than Ghirardelli ice cream!  I haven't been here in a while, so it was a great treat and brought back so many fond memories of weekends out with my family.  The line was out the door when we got there, but moved quickly.  They are so efficient and friendly.  Ordered the classic hot fudge sundae.  It was sooooo delicious.  Not too sweet, not too rich, but just right.  I forgot how much better ice cream tastes at an ice-cream parlor.
author: Jayce O.

description: I ordered the chocolate and rocky road ice cream and that alone for me is satisfying.
author: Grendel Z.

description:
***This new Ghirardelli location provides San Francisco residents and tourists the ability to try their popular ice cream sundaes without having to make the long trek to Fisherman's Wharf (many Ghirardelli locations only feature chocolates and no coffee or ice cream); in terms of their chocolates, a lot of the product here is standard stuff and surprisingly pricey given just the decent quality, but you can purchase individual chocolate squares and this store (like other standalone Ghirardelli locations) features much greater variety than what is available at a Target or a grocery store***

This Ghirardelli is located in a very busy area and street parking is very hard to find.  There are a few parking structures located in Union Square and you can also find metered street parking along the street that faces the Ferry Building.
author: Anthony N.

description:
I love hot fudge sundaes. 

Now add Ghirardelli

Then a melting Ghirardelli brownie

DONE-ZOE!
author: Greg F.

description: 20 minutes to make a hot chocolate?  Last time I checked that was like 2 ingredients, max.  Had to make a dash for the next BART, so didn't even get to receive our hot chocolate in time.  Employees were chatting it up and clearly in no hurry to serve (in a reasonable amount of time) the whopping 6 customers that were there.  Charged us 5 bucks, and not even an apology.  Good for you, Ghirardelli.  Thanks for taking our money without serving us. Waste of time and money.  Only attempted to go there because they were the only place open at the time.  Won't be back. would suggest that others find a better, local, higher quality establishment that doesn't treat it's customers like garbage.
author: Jeff T.

description:
Ghirardelli never does me wrong! EVER! I came here after a dinner with one of my best friends and we were thinking of splitting a sundae.. but knowing how they do it at the Ghirardelli by the pier, they're huge. So we just got one scoop of rocky road in a chocolate-dipped waffle bowl. Total was 5.70, but this one scoop is literally.. one HUGE scoop. Probably like two scoops for me since I don't eat that much. It was definitely good enough for the both of us for some dessert.

For the most part, what I'm trying to get at here is that if you already had the soda fountain experience at the tourist location, come here to the financial district and get your fix. It's more geared towards the locals and they do the same things at every other Ghirardelli: hand out free chocolate, sell bulk chocolate, and have hefty portions of ice cream and sundaes without the crowds, long lines and fighting for a table to sit at. The prices are the same as the North Point location, roughly $8-$10 for a meal-like sundae or malt shake. I'll probably come back for some coffee or tea and a light dessert next time. Service is always friendly and helpful, no doubt there.
author: Kathleen S.

description:
Cool lil shop. You can purchase chocolates, gifts, or ice cream featuring their chocolate. 

Friendly staff and typical prices for Ghiradelli. 

I got a classic sundae for a lil under $10. 
The ice cream was nothing to write home about. Classic vanilla ice cream by Dreyer's "/  you'd think they'd use better quality ice cream to douce in their chocolate but nope! I was actually pretty disappointed. I've had better sundaes at local ice cream shops in the east bay for much cheaper. I also didn't too much like the globs of thick chocolate in the sundae. I don't like my chocolate in sundaes to be a quarter inch thick and three inches long. They should use more of a chocolate drizzle. 

Overall, come for the merchandise (they have great gift ideas for any budget), the experience, free samples and friendly service but don't have too high of hopes for the sundae.
author: Keenya D.

description: I can't believe how many times i've walked by this place and never gone in - it's so great! Central location in financial district near ferry building. Lots of ice cream / sundae / shake options. I forgot what it was called but i had a shake with salted caramel, ice cream, and banana in it. Was nothing short of amazing, but also super sweet. My friend and i sat at the bar stools by the window which are great for people watching, the minir downside of that being that people can see you too, so be prepared for that lol. Clean place with friendly, attentive staff. And, of course, there's also bags ans bags of ghirardelli chocolates to buy as well
author: Bianca C.

description: DO NOT order your ice cream treats "to-go" no matter how busy the store is. Very disappointed and left with order-envy as we saw so many other full-size treats that eclipsed ours by a mile! Paid $33 for 2 adults treats and one small one for our daughter and super-bummed as we were trying to show off a SF staple to out-of-town company.
author: Rodney V.

description: The best place for a late night snack - staffs are helpful and very professional! They are aware of the flow of customers and the seating areas are cleaned! Prices are fair and portions are large-can share the banana split...They are located right downtown. Good for locals and tourists.
author: Stephanie C.

description: Cookie Sundae is delicious! Just a good as the shop in Ghiradelli Square and less crowded.
author: Amanda S.

description:
Best ice cream and hot fudge in the city.
Service is great and ambiance is perfect for a great dessert.
author: Jonathan H.

description: This is one of the top tourist attractions in SF. I had the espresso crunch and the ice cream was good. It's very sweet, good for dessert at night. This place is a must try as a tourist. The staff is friendly as well and it's clean inside.
author: Jaime F.

description:
Itz a ghiradeli fame but in a convenient location.
Prices: avg $10 sundaes
My fav is the ltd time strawberry fudge sundae which is usually available nr valentine's day. But tday is the 16th so unsure if it was for this yr

Service: 2nd visit n had the same server, allen. Was vry courteous n paid attentive to our requests

Sundae: has their ocean beaxh, salt n caramel sundae. If u lyk sweet n salty, this 1 is for u. I cant compare this sundae to bi-rite's bc itz only ice crm vs a sundae.

Bathroom facility: gd that a code is needed to open, but wen I had to use it, there was no toilet paper. Feel sorry for the ladies
author: Keikaikaoakua P.

description:
Chocolate and not crap american chocolate either!

We opted for the ocean sundae - which consisited of sea salt, caramel, chocolate and ice cream.  Boy it was a treat!  But I'm glad I shared one with hubbie as it was huge!

Every time you wank into this store you are treated to a bite sized ghiradhelli chocolate too.  

It's really good central location too.  Lots to choose from for gifts to take home too!
author: Emma W.

description: Shop is huge with cute decor with chocolate galore and ice cream surrounding a bar. Their Ghirardelli chocolate ice cream is the best! Their scoops are very generous compared to other ice cream shops, so I'd probably be content with just one scoop next time. I love it better than Byrite.
author: Cookie B.

description: Amazing ice cream creations! It's expensive, but worth every cent. The service is fast and friendly. Everything about this place is excellent!
author: Charles S.

description:
I had the espresso chip ice cream and it was heaven. I didn't get a free chocolate square qq but maybe they were understaffed or something when I went. 

I really want to try their sundaes in the near future.
author: Juliana P.

description:
Giving 5 stars because the service here is awesome! I noticed that most of the employees were young and just so attentive, polite, and welcoming. I was just so impressed by the service. I know it's an ice cream shop and not a restaurant, but they just provided such a great environment/ambience.

As for the ice cream, I ordered the Gold Rush sundae. I would order a sundae here, even though they are pricey. They are HUGE, and def fulfill that sweet tooth craving. You probably should share the sundae to not feel so guilty. The ice cream flavors are normal here. The chocolate pieces are definitely delish. Great place to stop by if you have a sweet tooth. It's definitely a San Francisco treat!
author: Kirby P.

description:
I still love this place after all these years! Even as the price of an ice cream sundae has gone up the loyal Ghiradelli chocolate lover in me stays!
Even on a cold day the fan comes to enjoy! It is busy folks! Yes, all the tourists are here and your party might do some table hunting, be prepared. 
You can purchase chocolates elsewhere as well but if you have never tried a Ghiradelli sundae, with this amazing chocolate fudge..you must!
author: Marie P.

description: There are not too many ice cream shops left, and this one is a good option at any of the many locations. This one is located in the historic Palace Hotel, and features comfortable seating (much more quiet than many of the other locations, such as the one a few blocks away at the Westfield Center), good service, and pretty good sundaes, etc. (I had a hot fudge brownie sundae with dark chocolate ice cream, and it was pretty good). If you are looking for something a bit more old fashioned and less corporate, try Fenton's in the East Bay (on Piedmont Avenue).
author: Jethro B.

description: You can't really go wrong in getting any kind of ice cream or Sunday topped with their delicious signature chocolate fudge sauce here. I've never had a bad experience at any ghirardelli's
author: Rehana K.

description: Of course, the food was great.  The tables had been left dirty and after I asked someone to clean the table, she disappeared for several minutes.  While she was gone, I figured she left for the day, so I used napkins and the water dispenser to clean the table myself.  While I was doing that, she returned with a warm cloth and did the job I already did.  Other tables needed attending, but, she walked off and left them.
author: Vanessa W.

description: If you are coming to San Francisco and love love chocolate. You cannot go wrong with this place!!!!
author: Dana S.

description:
I loveeeee ice cream! Some friends think I survive solely off of ice cream because I love it so much!

This place is my default ice cream shop since it's so close to home AND it's close to the office. wheee! Things to order from the cafe:
- Ghirardelli Hot Fudge Sundae
- Hot chocolate

Those are the two orders I ALWAYS default to...plus I bring my out-of-town guests here so they can get some souvenirs to take back home. It's a great alternative if you're running out of time and can't make it to Ghirardelli Square. Lovelovelove!

They have their chocolate selection of bars and assorted bags, plus the usual SF swag with chocolate in it. But the best part about the place is the "fill you own bag" section, where you can just create your own assorted baggies for $10/lb.

When I create a baggie, I get:
- Hazelnut Crisp
- Toffee Crunch
- Cookies and Creme 
- Milk Chocolate Truffle

Those are my favoriteeeee!! though..some ppl say the hazelnut crisp is way too sweet, to which I say -- if you don't want something sweet, why are you eating truffle/fru-fru chocolate? :) Might I also add that they have a good variety of dark cacao bars too? :)

Overall a great place! There are some great chocolate places in the area with artisan chocolate, but when you're in the mood for the classics...this is a convenient, good ole', down home spot to hit up!
author: Jennifer S.

description: Delicious sundaes and big portions. A bit touristy, but the product was quality. Two people can generally share one sundae, so that $12 price tag does not seem so unreasonable. If you want to buy Ghirardelli chocolate, it's wiser to purchase at your local drugstore like CVS or Walgreens. You'll get the same stuff for less $.
author: Ben K.

description: Delicious food! What more do you need to know? I have tried many different sundaes and shakes from here and not one of them has failed to impress me. The staff is super friendly and will help you if you're stuck on what to order. Also, the free samples that they hand out is a fun plus!
author: Ailish R.

description:
We don't have this ban on New York so it was a must to try! I ordered the Treasure Island. Ice cream with brownie! Who can say no to that.

It was quite sweet though, the brownie was too rich for my liking. But overall good experience. It reminds me of Serendipity's hot chocolate but dressed up!
author: Louise C.

description:
It was like a trifecta of a perfect storm:

+I was craving something sweet.
+I had had a small lunch.
+Some lady sitting by the window was going to town on a sundae.

I didn't walk here on my own accord. Some form--of divine intervention, karmaic intercession, the Flying Spaghetti Monster's intuition, whatever you believe--placed my feet in front of one another to enter the doors of chocolate heaven. 

(Actually, my boyfriend's chocolate heaven, but that's a story for when the kiddies go to bed...)

I ordered at the counter and watched the lovely ladies prepare the "World's Best Sundae." (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/ghirardelli-ice-cream-and-chocolate-shop-san-francisco-3?selected=-q8xXbSq-43zz6JF-3oQcg#UNAv_CFks-Of_v3QuFzWkw) Hot fudge with vanilla ice cream, tons of whipped cream, chopped almonds, and a Maraschino cherry on top. 

+Was it tasty? Yes.
+Was it worth $10? Yes.
+Did the chocolate surrounding you help? Yes.
+Were the servers friendly? Yes.
+Are you being forced to say "yes" because of some inexplicable force? Ye---wait, what? No! Really, it's one tasty, tasty sundae.
author: Adena B.

description: I needed a big batch of chocolate covered strawberries for my friends birthday and they came through for me with excellent service!!! It was pretty short notice. (only 1 day) but I stopped by the day before the party and they helped me arrange everything.  The next day they were ready for pick up when I needed them and they were in beautiful boxes.  Alicia helped me through the process. She's awesome!! Everyone loved them.  Side note: if you are every throwing a birthday party for someone that doesn't eat gluten consider avoiding the cake and getting some chocolate dipped strawberries!! Mmmmm!!
author: Brian L.

description: Stopped by here while in the downtown area, we were greeted by a chocolateer handing out free chocolate and starting conversation. There was a line for the bathroom that collided with the line to order which caused some confusion but both lines went fairly quickly. There isn't much room for a stroller to pass through that store so just a heads up, best to fold up your stroller or park it before coming in. The sundaes and shakes we purchased were very good.
author: Nikki H.

description: Who doesn't love chocolate? Ghirardelli is one of the top when it comes to chocolate brands, so coming by this shop is always a treat. And, it's the best place to make a pitstop as you end your shopping trip in Union Square. I've tried only a couple of the desserts, but my favorite has to be the Treasure Island Warm Brownie Sundae. The combination of brownies, fudge, & ice cream makes it a perfect dessert to share. The only downside is the slow service at times, but other than that, it's a great spot to pick up some of that famous chocolate or try the desserts!
author: Angela D.

description:
I'm very opinionated about my chocolate. I dislike chocolate that is waxy. I like dark chocolate but I consider myself a light weight since my chocolate of choice is usually semi-sweet. I can only take a maximum of 68-75% cocoa content before I find the chocolate too bitter. 

I picked up some chocolate as Christmas presents last month and I couldn't resist getting some for myself. I discovered that Ghirardelli has a dark chocolate I adore. It is the Intense Dark, Sea Salt Soiree with roasted almonds. 

Hey, it is not an excuse but a medical necessity. One ounce of dark chocolate is good for my health and those little bitty squares are just .375 ounces. I'm not sure about the % of cocoa but the first listed ingredient is semi-sweet chocolate.
author: Cece E.

description: The ice cream is tasty. The fudge sundaes are really good so anything you get is worth it!!
author: Cynthia M.

description: oh so yummy!  I don't even really like ice cream that much but I would eat this anytime!!!  What can I say.  You can't go wrong!
author: Kris H.

description:
This chocolate shop is exactly what you imagine when you think Ghirardelli.  Went in on a cool day in San Fran (i.e. any day), and had a good hot chocolate.  It was dead quiet when we were there, so service was great.  

Reason for 3 stars and not 4, was that while its a nice place, you can't shake the feeling that you're in a giant corporate chocolate shop.  Everything tasted formulaic, and while it was a good hot chocolate, it wouldn't register any-where near my top 50 or even 100 chocolates I've had.  (I really like chocolate).
author: James O.

description:
