Came here on Monday around 5pm with some girlfriends. Warmly greeted by a cute worker and offered samples! Yay!

$1 off an ice cream sundae check-in offer on Yelp? Thanks! My friend and I split a Muir Sundae, I think... It was blackforest cherry vanilla ice cream with a copious amount of whipped cream and a cherry on top. And best of all, generous helping of hot fudge! The fudge was to die for, and the cherry ice cream was tastier than I expected. Cherry was gross, whatever. 

Total was just over $9-$10, pretty standard. I only wish the sundae cups came in a bowl or with a plate... Because they were so messy/hard to spoon without spilling everywhere, felt bad for them. (sorry!)
Not the usual Ghirardelli's I visit while in the city, but I was craving a sugar fix after some shopping around Union Square. Decent!
author: Aimee V.

description:
While the product is good, this location was a disappointment.  
They ran out of caramel. Yes, an ice cream parlor ran out of caramel. Unapologetic. We figured out something else. 

Product arrived with three dirty, used spoons. Wet and sticky covered in whipped cream dirty. 

Also wrong ice cream flavors were served. 

Returned item to much attitude. 

Ice cream returned in a tiny plastic cup instead of usual glass. No chocolate square as advertised. 

I take my calorie bombs seriously. This was a disappointing San Fran experience.
author: Robin W.

description: Service is fast and the lines move quickly. You could never go wrong at this place when it comes to chocolate. Love the Espresso Escape! If you like coffee, you will love this one.
author: Jason A.

description: Fun place to take friends and family who are visiting SF. If you're in the mood to indulge, this is the place! Usually there is a line, but it moves fast and the service is fast. There are actually two cafes, making the service even more efficient. It's somewhere everyone should visit if they like chocolate and ice cream
author: Alisa M.

description: The lady at the counter gave me A LOT of attitude. I ordered a cone with cookies and cream ice cream and chocolate sprinkles; she gave me a chocolate dipped cone with chocolate ice cream. She rushed me and started laughing with her coworkers half way through my order. She looked at me in a rude manner and acted very courteous towards the foreign tourists next to me. I would not come here again due to her poor behavior towards customers.
author: Melissa G.

description: Disappointing. Hot chocolate had a distinctive burnt flavor. Clearly, the staff was overburdened to meet customer demand.
author: Diane B.

description: A gift for my daughter ;-) she likes chocolates so much. I chose a red metal box for her, with all kinds of different flavors.
author: Qingyi Z.

description: I had the classic hot chocolate mmmm...yummy. Great on a cold evening which apparently every evening in SF is, after dinner! I had a bite of a friends brownie,  OMG great . super rich.
author: Elisha J.

description: Amazing icecream!!! I could eat every single day... XD People who works there are also very nice and happy. If you decide to visit San Francisco, remember to stop by!!! You wont regreat. ;-)
author: Mariana B.

description: I'm a sucker for chocolate so this place was a 2nd Heaven for me. Stared at the menu for 10 minutes because everything looked so good I couldn't decide. Ended up going with one of the Painted Ladies named Espresso something. The menu picture does not attest to how large this thing really is. Definitely order this to share. Unless you're like me and took on the challenge of eating it solo. Anyways...this place is delicious. I couldn't remove the smile from my face the entire time I was inside. My 10 year old self came back to life and I didn't miss that at all. Go find yours!
author: Jeremiah M.

description: I would gain at least 10 pounds if i live close to here! I tried the brownie sundae and sea salt caramel. It was too much for me, so i took the "leftover" home and saved it for breakfast the next day! The choc was also special!
author: Chang L.

description: My favorite ice cream joint of all time.  It's not just that it's San Francisco based and I always love local company, but it's the sentiment of this joint.  I had the best childhood memories coming to the shop and sharing the absolute ridiculous size of monstrosity of ice cream with 5 other family members.  But, seriously, their chocolate sauce is really one of the best.  So smooth, not too sweet and always so creamy and comforting!
author: Julian B.

description: Needed something sweet after our great meal.  Got the Lands End.  Brownie Sundae.  Very busy location but well trained staff.
author: Travis B.

description:
We usually are at the Ghiradelli in Orlando when on vacation, and will usually make two to three trips in....The hot fudge is fantastic!

My sister and I spent my birthday walking around the city and wanted some dessert.  She knows how much I enjoy EVERYTHING here, so she made it a point for us to stop in on our way to BART.  We split the brownie sundae and it did not disappoint.  I've never been able to finish anything by myself here,  I would suggest splitting or come hungry!!
author: Marisa I.

description:
Ghirardelli ice cream. Can you ever go wrong with this?

We were craving ice cream after dinner along the Embarcadero, but made our way back to Market Street JUST for some Ghirardelli ice cream!

The staff was friendly and cleared off a table for us just as another family left. They took our order and delivered our sundaes within a few minutes. Love chocolate? GO HERE!

P.S. Free chocolate samples as always!
author: Leana L.

description: OMG! We had the Ocean Breeze sundae, vanilla ice cream layered with hot fudge and caramel. Yummy!
author: Laureen L.

description: I was craving something sweet and since Ghirardelli was on the way to our BART station, we stopped by on a Saturday afternoon. Surprisingly, it wasn't too busy so ordering was a breeze. A simple scoop of vanilla ice cream paired with a caramel sauce topping cost close to $7, which is very expensive in my opinion! Although they had about 4 employees working that day, the store was unkempt with dirty dishes and water cups everywhere. 4 stars due to the lack of cleanliness and prices, but 5 stars for that delicious caramel sundae.
author: Joyce E.

description:
Poor service.  Friday night was busy and it appears the management and staff were not trained for a busy evening.  Orders were mixed up or lost and items were made out of order so people that ordered later got their items sooner (not a crowd pleaser).

The mood the the packed place was tense and upset instead of fun.  I hope that Ghirardelli management reads this and figures out what to improve.  We like this location and when it is not busy, it has good service and great ice cream  We will give it another try.
author: Vivek V.

description: Not on a dare would I go back into this place.  The place was like a popular amusement park ride with no organization. People everywhere, the staff overwhelmed and impossible to keep the floors or tables clean.  I would assume the city of the historical great fire would have a occupancy limit for buildings and I am certain it was exceeded last evening.  We kept our order simple with 4 milkshakes and then waited to pounce on a table as someone began lifting their butts off of a seat.  It was a lot like seagulls chasing a piece of bread.  We ended up with 3 seats for 5 people.  The milkshakes were fine and the staff seemed to being doing their best. I have no idea how they moved through the sea of people with trays of orders without dropping them or getting them in the hair of patrons.  The shakes were good but hard to enjoy in that environment.  I would say this is a pretty disappointing way to represent the Ghiradelli brand and certainly is not an experience that you would have in Hershey, Pennsylvania.  I think we are pretty much jaded on the Ghiradelli brand forever as a family.
author: Jeff B.

description: The sundaes here are absolutely fantastic. There is even one where I work, so I am gonna have to be careful, otherwise I am gonna end up eating nothing up ice cream all day long. The Warm Brownie Sundae has been my favorite so far, but then again, I have yet to sample the entire menu, time will tell.
author: Bryan M.

description:
My finacee and I were looking for some late night sweets and were surprised to see this location open when ever other business in the area was packed up for the night. On top of that, all the employees were very friendly and knowledgeable about their selection. 

And as always, the fresh dipped chocolate waffle cone and ice cream was delicious!
author: Conor B.

description:
So disappointed!! This review is specifically for the "original ice cream sundae" - the square itself was a great place to hang out! 

I was so looking forward to having the classic, original "world famous" sundae but I have to say, it was likely the worst I've ever had - and I love chocolate and ice cream!! It's hard to imagine how it could taste bad but it was bland and flavorless.  Not sure if it was an off day (it was a Tuesday afternoon) or what.. I kept trying to come up with some excuse for it being terrible, bad batch of hot fudge, poor technique when creating, bottom of the barrel ice cream? None of these make sense tho!  I would have gone with a more exciting option vs the original if I knew the taste was going to be so blah.  We didn't even eat a quarter of it! To back up my point, I gave my 16 mo old daughter a taste of ice cream and she didn't want a second... Bland flavor confirmed! 

I did order a cappuccino which was delicious, but right toward the end I noticed a gnat landed in the foam and I thought, yep this is par for the experience! I love their chocolates but won't be ordering another world famous classic sundae.
author: Jacquelyn T.

description:
Not quite Willie Wonka and his Chocolate Factory, but it's pretty close!

What's there not to love about this spot.  There's chocolate, ice cream, chocolate ice cream, some concoction with various items, and sundaes.  This is a two in one spot.  You can grab some dessert to stay and eat at a table OR you can purchase gifts for folks.  Either way I like the ambiance of the place and the employees who work here are very nice!  

This is my go to spot for sundaes!
author: Bernie C.

description: I received a free random free banana split from an angel who shall remain nameless! Very delicious! I'm a satisfied customer! :)
author: Trunina O.

description: The ice cream dish was great, servings are HUGE so the most important part gets the best rating, the food.  It is light on stars as the place was not clean, service a bit slow, seating layout not great for flow to cashiers etc.
author: Lisa J.

description: Coffee is eh. Cream is processed. Staff are high school kiddos. Big chain chocolates. But maybe I'm just particular about coffee & chocolate, and many other people may love this place.
author: Courtney M.

description: 4 stars only because I don't like sweets.  Everyone I was with loved it!   The chocolate fudge is the best in the Bay Area.   I would recommend this spot for families kids love sweets!!
author: Cory F.

description:
Same great ice cream bar as the one in Ghirardelli Square minus the huge long wait.

This one is conveniently located on the corner of Market St and New Montgomery by the Palace Hotel and the Montgomery St BART station.

I popped in to buy some chocolate foiled squares and then caught the Muni Metro home.  

Next time I'll need to order an ice cream sundae given more time.
author: Shirley N.

description: IT'S WAY TOO SWEET!!!!!! a little more expensive than usual (not as much as dandelion) but it's extremely sweet and it honestly doesn't have the fullness that dandelion chocolate has. Go to valencia and give it a try.
author: Chanun O.

description: Simply amazing. The ice cream menu was fun and unique.  I did the Sea Salt Caramel sundae in a homemade waffle bowl. It was delicious. A great mixture of sea salt with caramel and hot fudge. The prices are high but the portions are huge and well worth it!
author: Morgan R.

description:
I used to work at this Ghirardellii, so I can probably provide some fairly descent tips for all of you who want to improve your Ghirardelli experience ;)

Tip #1: Firstly, I must strain that Ghirardelli uses DREYERS icecream. If you come into the store and buy a single scoop of ice-cream with no toppings, you are wasting your money. THE TOPPINGS ARE WHAT MAKE THE ICECREAM.

Tip #2: If you order a sundae, such as the Ghirardelli famous Hot Fudge sundae, I urge you to ask for your hot fudge ON THE SIDE. Otherwise, the Hot Fudge will melt the ice-cream, and you will be left with a puddle. It happened all the time while I worked there, and it left a lot of people unhappy.

Tip #3: There are a lot of specialty sundaes/beverages that are not provided on the menu. Ask about the Domingo, the Marina Sundae, the Muir Woods, the Seacliff, and the drinking chocolate.

Tip #4: Customize your order! One of the best parts of Ghirardelli was that anything in the menu could be customized to your palate. Add butterscotch, a second cherry, marshmallow syrup, dark chocolate fudge, pineapples, and a variety of other savory treats to really improve your experience. 

Tip #6: For all of you coffee lovers, i recommend you not to waste your money here. Ghirardelli beverages are not as good as its ice creams. The coffee, espressos, lattes, and cappuccinos are fairly average quality and fairly high costing. The Hot chocolate can be good, but it is very sweet, so you must keep that in mind. ALSO, While the brownies and cookies are delicious, they are NOT made in the store, but rather shipped in frozen. They are also VERY sweet, so keep that in mind. If that doesnt bother you, feel free to try them :)

Tip #7: My final tip is basically just some of the sundaes which I liked most. Unlike most of the yelp reviews on  here, I have been able to try every single flavor of ice-cream, topping, milkshake, chocolate, and sundae that the store has sold. 

Favorite icecream: plain Icecream is really nothing special at Ghirardelli. Id say that the mint and blackcherry have the most accurate flavors though.

Favorite topping: All of Ghirardellis toppings are shipped in pre-canned except for the fudge, which is made right in the store, and because the store specializes in chocolate, I highly recommend it. 

Favorite milkshake: the Quake shakes are by far the best milkshakes in the store. My favorite is the seasalt caramel quake shake, but you cant go wrong with any option.

Favorite Chocolate: All of the Ghirardelli chocolate is delectable, but each has an important characteristic. For dark chocolate lovers, its important to remember that the higher the cacao percentage is, the more bitter the chocolate will be. 86% dark chocolate is very bitter, while 60% is typical dark chocolate. As for the flavored chocolates, I dont recommend the brownie fillings. They are too sweet (which is a common flaw in the store). You can never go wrong with sample chocolates. Typically, caramel chocolate and Sea Salt Almond are the most popular, as well as my personal favorites.

Good luck! Enjoy the store. It has a lot to offer ;)
author: David D.

description: Amazing chocolate shop right Downtown San Fran! Tons of chocolates to buy and choose from (warning! It is a bit pricey) but the best part is that they have an ice cream shop located in the chocolate shop serving up ice cream dishes that are to die for! All ice cream uses their famous Ghirardelli chocolate as well. Yum!
author: Hana P.

description:
Bought some chocolate here last night! It was delicious and we got a free sample.


The chocolate covered strawberries are steeply priced (4.95) but still very good! 
 
I will be back to try the ice cream!
author: Kayla N.

description:
YES!

You must stop here if either visiting or living in the city.  The chocolate is unparalleled.  I would say it is worth the possible diabetic coma.

I drank the hot chocolate and almost cried.  Try also getting their version of a frozen hot chocolate.  It is awesome.  Couple that with chocolate dipped strawberrys and you'll be in sweetness heaven.

From the dining area you have a perfect view of the bay and a little part of the trolly station. 

The service was perfect.  They even made the chocolate strawberries early for me since I came right at opening.

The entire area is well kept, I was very impressed.  This is a must stop.
author: Ryan V.

description: Quintessential San Francisco stop. Yes, you can buy most of the stuff in stores around the country. But you certainly can't find a fresh made Ghirardelli Double Hot Cocoa. It's the perfect SF accoutrement while traversing the sometimes chilly streets. What makes this place especially nice are the free flowing samples. Want to try something before buying - no problem, just ask for a sample! Kind and generous - my kind of chocolate place!
author: McKenzie S.

description: Very Nice location, during the holidays season and I usually get my hot Sea Salt Hot Chocolate paired with some gourmet Chocolate ! I always like to sit by the windows and watch all different kind of people passing by! It is an experience and a moment that I enjoy from time to time! It makes me very happy. Then I end up buying some chocolate for my family and myself!
author: Mido E.

description:
I've been here over 10+ times. 

Walk in, skip the free samples and order a sundae of your choice. My recommendations are the strawberry sundae or the salted caramel. 

- Hot fudge is heaven. 5 stars. Get it dark. 

- Ice cream is Dreyers 4 stars 

- Each sundae averages $10. It's big enough for two. If you want a mini sundae that's half the size, it'll be a buck less. 

- Very clean. Service is attentive. People watching is cool.
author: Momo M.

description:
First time to the Mission Street location. Very similar experience to the Ghirardelli square location, except no lines, and really light-speed-like service. Had the fudge brownie sundae with two spoons. It totally satisfied both of us.

It's nice to see the proliferation of Ghirardelli ice cream shops!
author: Reyn J.

description: We loved this little gem at the bottom of the palace hotel.  They had some of the best ice cream sundaes ever!  What a treat!  We loved the gold rush and strike it rich!  As well as being delicious, the aroma of chocolate wafts in the air and the presentation of the sundaes belies true frozen food skill!  A great place for desert and fun!
author: Al P.

description:
Inside: the shop is very colorful and tourist-friendly. Lots of varieties for purchase, and you are greeted with a complimentary chocolate at the door. Environment is charming, has ample seating, and makes for a great stop if you're walking near the Embarcadero, Soma, or Union Square.

Food: The made-to-order options include various ice cream and drink options, including hot chocolate, baked goods, and the infamous hot fudge sundae. 

The sundae is exactly what you would expect; normal ice cream with an above-average-tasting fudge drenched on top. Given the hype, I was expecting something to really "wow" me, but in the end this is just a normal (but tasty) sundae.

The hot chocolate is synonymous with warm milk with a hint of chocolate, not anywhere near as chocolately as I would've hoped. I have ordered this drink twice at this location (expecting that maybe I just had a new employee making the drink the first time) and the results were the same.

As an avid chocolate lover, I had Ghiradelli at the top of my list when first coming to the city. After visiting this location a few times and generally getting accustomed to the SF foodie scene as a whole, I think this location is fine and has some good offerings, but is nothing to write home to mom and dad about.
author: Shawn R.

description: Oh how I love ice cream.  I am a firm believer that Star Wars is the best movie series ever and that ice cream cures all. Now if only we can figure out a way to have it be guilt free, like no fat or calories.  I love love love ice cream, I can literally eat an entire quart of it in one sitting.  On that note, this is the shop on Market, its convenient if you're in the area but the  one near  pier 39 has a better atmosphere.  On that note, they have great chocolate and hot chocolate here, ice cream on the other hand just average.  I think Bi-Rite has better quality ice cream.  But sure stop in and get your chocolate fix, the staff is friendly and the service is good.
author: Angela V.

description: I'm allergic to nuts and they put nuts in my Hot fudge sundae. Customer service was very rude. Owners need to have a talk with lady that made my sundae. You can be held liable for injuries or death.
author: Keith B.

description: Who does not know Ghirardelli. Our Manager took us all out for dessert at this place. We share each other, I love them all. Their chocolate is the best. I use their baking chocolate too,
author: Maria S.

description: This is our favorite ice cream shop in the world. We first started our love affair with Ghirardelli on a trip we made to Vegas back in 2006 and were so happy to know we had one in Lincoln Road which of course we used to go almost every weekend until they closed it down. Now the nearest one we have it's in Orlando :(. Back to our review, our first day in San Francisco of course we went and it was just as good or better that we remember. We ordered their world famous sundae which had one scoop vanilla one scoop chocolate, whipped cream and the hot fudge with their delicious chocolate. The shop also sells all types of their chocolate confections.
author: Zaida C.

description: The shop smells like decadent sweet chocolate...How is it possible NOT to get a sundae when you're here?  I got the Ocean Sundae, which is similar to the normal sundae, but with caramel syrup and sea salt. It was good, but I think the caramel syrup actually made it TOO sweet. I will probably just get the classic sundae next time. The sea salt was a nice touch. The fudge is sooo good, but it would be better if Ghiardelli actually made the ice cream they used, and not Dreyers.
author: Rosanna K.

description:
So amazingly delicious. One thing we always look forward to while in San Francisco... We came here and since my lactose intolerance has been pretty bad lately, I asked for soy in my drink (not seen as an option on the menu) and they said no problem and did not even charge me extra for the substitute! My stomach thanks you... Then we enjoyed picking out our own tins of the individual chocolate squares...mmm. we got 63 pieces for $20! Score! 

See you next time Ghirardelli!
author: Jenelle J.

description: When I die, this is how I imagine heaven is like but of course without the heavy calories.
author: Vinson H.

description:
It's so hard for me to give Ghiradelli anything lower than 5 stars. The service was slow at this particular location. The servers mixed up our order with someone else's. 
Also, I was so disappointed that they discontinued the Goldrush sundae. Ghiradelli no longer carries peanutbutter sauce so they cannot make it. 
Apparently there were reports of cross contamination with someone who has a serious peanut allergy. 
I'm very allergic to fish & seafood & I live in the Bay Area. I completely understand having a food allergy. I always tell my server to make sure my food is separate from fish/seafood. 
I don't understand why they can't keep one scooper labeled with peanutbutter & don't let other scoopers or dishes go near. Jamba Juice does this. 
This Ghiradelli was a regular stop for my hubby and Me when we're in the city. Now we're not going to go out of our way for it.
author: K F.

description: Sundaes are amazing! Our group had the Crissy Field (Cookie bits sundae), Strike It Rick (butterscotch hot fudge sundae) & Painted Lady, Mint Bliss. Everyone was happy with their order. Chocolate fudge is so rich and yummy. Limited tables, but there are counter seats. Service great. Order at the register, they bring it to you. Lots of chocolate to purchase to take home. Only one bathroom and you need to get someone to unlock it for you. It is on a busy street and it is not a public restroom.
author: Elizabeth J.

description:
Don't get the mint chocolate chip ice cream. It tasted very powdery. I'm pretty sure it's not supposed to taste that way. This is actually a really cool place, with sort of a johnny rocket's feel where you can sit at the counter and they serve you your ice cream in a little platter, however, the texture of the ice cream really ruined it for me.

The decor of this place is awesome though. They probably have some better dessert options, and I might go back and try some of their shakes sometime - but mint chocolate chip ice cream - never again.

Service here is a-okay too. Not amazing, but not unfriendly.
author: Junel S.

description:
I tried to find something that I disliked about the place and the quality of the products and was unable. It was nice to go at night and with a small group of people.
Not one of us was disappointed by their order. While I opted for the delicious (rich in texture and flavor!), my friends opted for ice cream (which the devoured in three seconds) and a sundae. It was a very good decision and the perfect place to stop for dessert.
author: Paola S.

description: The nicest people ever in one of the most beautiful chocolate shops I've had the privilege of being in. Get the sea salt caramel hot chocolate on a windy night!
author: Jon S.

description: We got the Crissy Field and the hot chocolate which totaled about 18$$$. The Crissy Field is enough to fill one person from hungry to full. It's really a lot and its super sweet but would recommend. The hot chocolate they served was very weird. It was really sweet for the first 5 seconds then became really bitter. Would not recommend
author: Justin N.

description: I stopped here because I wanted to get a free sample and look around. The store is easy to find as you can just follow your nose like toucan Sam. The sample was amazing and I enjoyed it. The store has almost every square of chocolate flavor that I can remember them ever making. I would have loved to have dined here but I was full from another great eats. Next time for sure.
author: Amanda K.

description:
I had something to celebrate and I did it with a $10 sundae.
It was delicious but way two much.
On the way out a homeless lady asked me to buy her one., and I said sorry no cash and she said "they take credit cards" you can't make this up you have to live in SF.
author: Joe H.

description:
Good factory standard for hot chocolate on Market in FiDi. Set next to the Palace, so while it lacks the originating history of the one on the north side of town, it's still situated in a building that's over a hundred years old. 

It's a new location and not all staff are aware about offerings and how to make certain drinks. The tables are often a bit sticky, but there's plenty of napkins to DIY clean.
author: Yosun C.

description: I love coming here whenever I'm in SF. Any city you're in, stop into the Ghirardelli-- the ice cream sundaes are fun and you can't go wrong with the chocolate. I travel a lot for work and I'm always stopping in for ice cream!
author: Jessica F.

description:
Warming up.

Bumgarner for another monster season: http://www.sfgate.com/giants/article/Spring-training-Bumgarner-throws-first-bullpen-6090399.php

Ghirardelli for another monster dessert: Chocolate chip for chocolate chip this is one of the biggest cookies in the city. Perfectly moist and chewy. Bit salty too.

Staff asks if you want it warmed up. Upon tasting the perfection after a few minutes heated you won't want it any other way. And for $5 the price demands perfection.

It's a championship contender.
author: Jason B.

description: You know how you used to eat something in your childhood and you remember it fondly as something that was really good? Then you eat it as an adult and you think, "What the heck was I thinking?". That was my experience here the other day. I haven't had anything from Ghirardelli in years, so hubby and I decided to split a salted caramel sundae. There was so little caramel or topping in the sundae, that my husband got up and asked for a little side of the caramel sauce to pour on top. The ice cream is flavorless and we actually didn't finish the sundae. Both of us were so disappointed at how bland everything was. It was much better in my memory!
author: Goldi J.

description:
Has a bar, sit down dining area, complete selection of chocolates. Best of all, it's right down my hotel.

Recommending classic hot cocoa for a slightly cooler night. Service is good and take outs are discounted.
author: Romella J.

description:
It's a Ghirardelli store so you know what to expect: delicious (albeit a little expensive) chocolate and sundaes. I normally don't get the sundaes, but I love the chocolate. When you walk in, you'll be greeted by a friendly worker offering a free sample. During the holiday season, they give samples of the special peppermint bark flavor. It's so good!

The location is also very convenient, a literally 15-foot walk from the Montgomery BART station and right by the office. I'll often treat myself to some Ghirardellis after work if I feel like I've earned it.
author: Nikhil S.

description: Richest chocolate you've ever had! The sundae was too good and rich to finish even for 2 people. They show you the process of making chocolate so there's history there. A bit pricey but quality cost
author: Kenya W.

description: Even though it's winter I could not resist ordering ice cream. It was to die for. The staff consisted of mainly young people, but they were nice and polite
author: Madeleine S.

description: Chocolate heaven.  Walls and mounds of chocolate everywhere. Pretty cool to look at. Right as we walked in, one of the workers greeted us and offered us a sample. I think it was milk chocolate with caramel. It was really good. The workers were really nice and helpful. I didn't try the ice cream sundae  this visit but the menu looks incredible. I might have to try it at the other location by the wharf though. And when you check in on yelp it offers you a $1 coupon off any sundae so that's cool
author: Tammy W.

description:
Had the cookie bits sundae. I should rephrase that, I split the cookie bits sundae and it was delicious. I had a hard time deciding between the cookie bits, the espresso sundae, and the brownie sundae. I am not sure if there was a wrong call but we definitely made the right one. Two scoops of cookies and cream ice cream with another of vanilla, some chocolates, whipped cream, and cookie crumbles all over it. I don't think you can mess that up. The vanilla itself was pretty meh (and i actually like vanilla a lot) so I would hesitate to order a sundae that was mostly vanilla. Make them substitute that flavor for something better.

This shop is a nice place to grab some very large sized desserts. They give you free samples as you walk in the door and have a great assortment of chocolates to buy if you are considering an early death for either yourself or your wallet. I will most certainly be back.
author: Luke O.

description: Hadn't been here in years. I was born and raised here in SF. This place was really disappointing. Waited over a 1/2 hr to get in to just place our order. There isn't much for seating and they had the upstairs closed. I ordered a hot fudge sundae that was $9.95, which in my mind is a bit for icecream. We waited another 1/2 hr to get our order, which was already melting by the time they get it to you. The hot fudge wasn't even hot and the whole experience in my mind was a big waste of time and not even that delicious. I wouldn't waste my time waiting again at this place. There are other ice cream shops that taste better and aren't as expensive.
author: Ronette B.

description: Insane ice cream sundays here. Awesome location. The perfect stop for a visiting tourist.
author: Andrea C.

description: I LOVE chocolate! And Ghirardelli chocolate is my kryptonite :) A great place to hang out and people watch and the menu has plenty to choose from. If you're in the area, also check out Ghirardelli Square!
author: Stephanie W.

description: Terrible Terrible service,  they tricked me on the price and weight of the chocolates and assumed no blame.  I live in the neighborhood and don't appreciate the bad service.
author: Iva L.

description:
Suuuuuper friendly staff! Very clean place.

The new OCEAN BEACH is A MUST!!!! :-) It is soooooooooooooooo yummie!!!!!!!!! Vanilla ice cream with home made fudge, caramel, whipped cream with salt on top.
author: C K.

description: I am still salivating over my sundae and Bunny wishes that there was one in Cleveland. Great staff and very helpful. Hot fudge is delicious. Clean quickly changed tables. Nothing bad here only good.
author: Kevin M.

description: The Ice cream is so good!!!!  I got cookies and cream ice cream with dark hot fudge on it. I hate hot fudge when its too sweet. Ghiradelli is right on on the sweetness. I would definitely go there again. It was one of the best ice creams I have ever had.
author: Ankeen T.

description:
I was in San Francisco, so it was a given that I would have to get some Ghirardelli chocolates and ice cream.

I really liked this shop.  Nice layout for dine-in with separate registers off to the side just for those shopping.  Went with a simple hot fudge sundae, only it wasn't simple in terms of flavor.  Really love the rich taste of the hot fudge and creamy ice cream here at Ghirardelli.  Plenty of table and bar space, and staff was all around friendly.

I helped myself to the free samples when picking up some souvenir chocolates to take home. I went with some Halloween-designed boxes for the kids on my list and went with San Francisco Golden Gate bridge boxes for the adults.

I also created a little baggie for myself to enjoy throughout my trip in SF.  My favorite being the eggnog and hazelnut.

My visits (2, the second just to pick up more chocolate) here during my trip were in the evenings.  I enjoyed he ambiance inside at night.  Nice, soft lighting and not overly hectic though still busy even around 9pm.
author: Irene Z.

description: this is the best location in my opinion. it's never busy and the quality never disappoints! the brownies and cookies are ALWAYS warm unlike the big square at fishermans wharf.
author: Taylor M.

description: Great service and never crowded! I love this location even more after visiting the madness that is the location in Ghirardelli Square.
author: Angela C.

description:
My view on Ghirardelli chocolate shops: expensive chocolate sundaes for when someone feels like splurging a bit cause the chocolate and ice cream desserts are delicious!  

The average sundae's about $10, which I would recommend sharing with someone cause all that sugar gets pretty filling and it's just not as good at the end. Also makes it easier on the wallet. It's not an everyday kind of thing, but maybe once it a while, they're just what your taste buds need to make your day a bit happier.
author: Teresa P.

description:
What I Ate
- Sea Cliff ice cream sundae (chocolate chip cookie, vanilla ice cream, fudge, nuts, and whipped cream) in a chocolate-dipped waffle bowl

Would I Go Again
Due to Ghirardelli's flagship chocolate and ice cream shot being located near San Francisco's Fisherman's Wharf, I feel like Ghirardelli gets a bad rap at "touristy."  When I think of touristy restaurants, I think of long lines, high prices, and bad food.  When I think of Ghirardelli ice cream shops, I think of the best-ever cookie sundae in the best-ever waffle bowl.  The Colossal Chocolate Chip Cookie lives up to its name--if that massive piece of baked goodness is only half, I don't even want to know how my stomach would feel if I hate the full cookie!  The cookie is delicious, and I'll leave it at that.  

The ice cream is very good--quality, but nothing fancy.  The vanilla knows its role is to only complement the cookie and waffle bowl, which is does with remarkable ability.  The fudge is, of course, outstanding; however, the real standout here is the waffle bowl.  Perfect in every way and only enhanced by Ghirardelli's delicious chocolate coating the edges.  It is so good that I think it would be perfectly reasonable to order just the waffle bowl, maybe with a glass of milk on the side.  Though, I wouldn't that.  Leave the calorie counter at home and go for the Sea Cliff--share it with someone if you like, but just order it.  I am confident that you won't be disappointed!
author: Ben M.

description:
Ghirardelli is my wife and I's favorite ice cream stop. I always get a single scoop of espresso chip with dark chocolate fudge. The wife always samples something different.

My biggest complaint is that they ALWAYS get at least one thing wrong. Most of the time the people taking orders are barely paying attention to you. Especially if you do any customizing of the standard menu. I've gotten to the point where I expect something to be wrong and I just complain or ask for what I actually wanted when they bring the wrong thing. Every once in a while they have some punk kids working there who are rude.

I will always go back though. The sub-par service doesn't matter, I want my fudge!

update: I've been to other locations where they don't make mistakes. It's really only this one. But i'll deal with it since i'm near by.
author: Aaron S.

description: A good sized store on Market.  This place is where you can get your sugar fix.  The hot fudge is really good. I would recommend the hot fudge sundae if you're hungry. If not, get the single scoop sundae.
author: Brian C.

description:
Yummm! We went here later for our sweet tooth craving. We seemed to have just beat fans returning from a baseball game. The line became long really quickly. 

We shared the sea salt caramel sundae. It was more than enough for the two of us. Delicious!
author: Alicia A.

description:
2 stars for the sweet tooth craving.

I went in after a sort of slow day for myself. Born & raised in this city, paying the ever growing rent, you have to imagine days off are spent recovering And getting ready for the next work day. I cAme to ghirardelli to reward myself After a very arduous work week.

They ran out of numbers during my transaction, when the cashier(Wendy) was offered a number to assign me she passed on it. She informed me that they would "scream out your name from the middle of the bar" and swiftly told me that my sundae would come in glass. I look forward to these events for myself. The cold ice cream, hot fudge, sweet cherries, and light whipped cream are what makes the nostalgia come over me as I savor the flavors.
I finally find a seat and patiently wait only to see the few patrons in front of me receive their confections in glass, metal dishes, real spoons. So, when I heard my name being called out I happily made the trip to the bar only to be carelessly handed my dessert in plastic. I took what I paid for and enjoyed it. I then see patrons that were behind me receive their dessert in glass, with a smile, and friendly service.
All I got from the server, James, was a sort of "take your sundae, be happy we made you one, and get out" service as he joked with his co worker. I saw James prepare a sundae for 2 young ladies very very carefully. And here I was 2 bites into my sundae and my fudge was frozen over, hard to chew, and running over. Plastic does not hold the fudge over as glass. As I struggled to eat with my plastic spoon I just felt sad. Here I am, working hard to make a living in the city and the one time I feel to reward myself I get looked over on the one thing I wanted to enjoy that day.  I will not bring my money back to spend here.  The managers really need to take into consideration that consistency in service and what they put out remains in the heads of people who frequent this establishment. Why wasn't I given a number? How come I didn't get it in a glass? The supervisor, young Filipino man with a pony tail And the manAger,  should see the value in consistency and coming thru on what you say.

Wendy.... If you say something is going to happen AND you take the customers money right after, it's better you don't lie. And when you see that your word wasn't enough, correct it. That's great customer service.

James... Next time don't rub your face and hair without washing your hands before assembling food. Not only is that a health code violation but the fact that it's a habit cements the idea that I shouldn't spend my money here because you are not sanitary.

SF blue collar local since '86.
Not some rich techie from Google.
author: David C.

description: Love this shop. Service is always great and they give you little pieces of chocolate when you walk in (don't get too excited it's the sea salt caramel one). My coworker and I always come here for a treat after a long hard week. Use yelp $1 discount if you can!
author: Ameera D.

description: It's a bit of sensory overload in here, but the ice cream is great.  I had a scoop of chocolate and a scoop of mint chocolate chip in a chocolate covered waffle bowl with hot dark chocolate sauce (and a double espresso).  Zing!!
author: Tim A.

description: Yes, this is a touristy spot but this is somewhere you need to get off the bucket list. And like all touristy places it is pricey. There are a plethora of ice cream shops in SF, but I enjoy visiting Ghirardelli's Ice Cream and Chocolate Shop. It is a a fun and unique SF experience with a nice/interesting environment. Come here to get your chocolate fix. Their Warm Brownie Sundae is amazing and my favorite. The staff is pleasant and courteous.
author: Soroosh A.

description: Super touristy! You can just get a better hot chocolate from any local cafe; for chocolate; walgreens offer a cheaper price.
author: Joelle K.

description:
This place would've gotten 5 stars if they updated their ticketing/delivering of the orders.  If you choose to sit-down, you are given a number and usually end up on a mad hunt trying to find a table to sit down.  Once you find a table, it's a waiting game.  Your icecream is delivered to you by their workers dressed with little Ghiradelli hats and gloves.  It's really quite cute but I'd give up that little novelty if it meant my icecream will be delivered straight to me without any melting.

SF is obviously known for Ghirardelli Square so going here is an absolute must for everyone! The icecream is delicious and I ALWAYS go back for the Very Berry Sundae.  What I came to realize is that the "To-go" portion is significantly larger than the "Sit-down" portion because of the containers they serve you.  Each icecream entree runs around $8-9 but if you check into Yelp, you'll get $1 off a sundae (which is nice).  Don't forget that you can choose what flavors of icecream you want in your order if you don't want the "stock" flavor.  This place is ALWAYS packed so be prepared to wait!  

My bf and I are absolutely addicted to this place ever since we moved here to SF.  Because of the price, we are trying to limit ourselves to coming here only 1x a month :)

updated: The Very Berry Sundae is officiall discontinued :( The visit when I discovered this, I ordered the traditional hot fudge sundae instead...and well...it was just as wonderful!  BEST icecream spot ever!
author: Anna G.

description: Visited TWICE the two days we were in town! It was that good! Get the 'Treasure Island' it's a hot fudge sundae with a brownie!! It's the BEST! The chocolate is so fresh and rich! I recommend the treasure island because the 'world famous sundae' only has ice cream and hot fudge, it's missing something, hints the brownie! You won't be disappointed with the Treasure island! Also, a new favorite is the 'Lands End,' it's caramel, hot fudge, vanilla ice cream, 2 brownies& whipped cream& a cherry! YUM!!!
author: Katie J.

description: If you love chocolate & ice cream, definitely come here to give it a try! Totally worth it  I had the treasure island and the brownie was amazing. It's a perfect combination with the ice cream and the caramel
author: Chelsea T.

description:
This place is at a great location. Close to both muni and bart :) It provides shelter and sweets when you're exhausted and waiting for someone to pick you up!

They have really good sea salt hot chocolate- a must!
author: Jenna L.

description:
I had the Chocolate Malt... YU--MEEEEEE!! So rich and delicious. It's $6.25 (ouch) but worth it to me. A good quality malt.

Nice clean, good presentation, menu at the door, nice and friendly staff.
author: Wallace A.

description: Love this place.  Might have been one of the best basic awesome Hot Fudge Sundae's I've ever devoured!  Great place to inhale ice cream and people watch in the city.
author: Mel B.

description: Great place to have ice cream with lots of toppings.  Wait time is not bad given number of people that eat here. Gave them a 3 due to service attitude. Felt like I was on a manufacturing line. If you don't know what you want then you have to step aside and let next person go. Everything is rushed with no time to be friendly.  And when I reminded server that I ordered water I waited 10 mins for another server to get bottled water.  Great place to visit but don't expect that warm, fuzzy interaction with the servers.
author: J S.

description: A local favorite that is a bit too close too home for me. It's way too tempting to walk past here and not stop in. They always give out free chocolate samples. So even if you don't buy anything you come out satisfied.
author: Brian F.

description: Yummy yummy yummy real ice cream with Ghirardelli hot dark chocolate fudge = such a delightful treat.
author: Anna K.

description: Everyone working here is friendly and welcoming. My son was in heaven because, well....CHOCOLATE. They offer samples. We had ice cream, and it was delicious!
author: Amii P.

description: Not surprisingly, the Ghirardelli chocolate ice cream tastes pretty legit. And, you get a free mini chocolate square just for stepping inside. America.
author: Maximillian M.

description:
I pass this location every day on my way to work, thinking, "those blue lights are so pretty, and I bet everything tastes so good..." when finally this weekend, I was doing some holiday shopping in the city and there were a million and one Ghirardelli people hitting the streets passing out Peppermint bark! 

After nomming on a few, I knew I had to get more! I went to the location inside the Westfield which had a limited assortment, and a great deal on Milk CHocolate Peppermint Bark in a huge 80ct bag for $25! BUT I wanted Dark Chocolate Bark for my dad for Xmas.... they didn't seem to want to help me out so I went over to the New Montgomery location, was happily greeted by a nice gentleman, and then they too did not have the 80ct bag in Dark Choc, but the gentleman hand counted 80 pieces and created a bag just for me!

Excellent Customer Service. Excellent Street Marketing. Excellent Product!
author: Katie K.

description: "This is HEAVEN," said the Little Niece.  What sparked that statement?  Was it the free sample of Peppermint Bark?  Was it the Presidio Passion sundae with strawberries, hot fudge and amazing whipped cream?  Was it the strawberry Quake Shake made with an entire chocolate bar blended in?  And not a puny chocolate bar either.  It looked like a massive 3.5 ounce one!  No matter.  She is a child after my own heart.  She, her sister and I will definitely be back!
author: J. P.

description: It's exactly what you probably expect .. Delicious ice cream sundaes in large portions that are pretty over priced.. But when in Rome!
author: Patricia M.

description:
This is an amazing place!  I  was here once when I visited some friends in San Francisco.
The place has such a wide variety of treats I had no idea where to start. I had a delicious hot chocolate and it just tasted amazing.
author: Mayra S.

description: I'm writing because I can't believe how they trick their customers. I bought two boxes of chocolate that I didn't know were expired. I was visiting SF and bought them as gifts. I took the price tag off of one box and saw that they were expired. The same thing happened with the other one. It's upsetting that the store is selling expired chocolate but even more appalling that they tried to cover it with a price sticker. Truly disappointed.
author: Jong L.

description: Decent ice cream sundaes with many combos to choose from! The exciting parts of these sundaes is that they use Ghirardelli chocolate as the sauce. We ordered the intense dark chocolate and mint sundae in a waffle cone and it was good (if not a bit too rich and sweet). Overall, good experience.
author: Jan Z.

description: Love this place!  Less crowded than the original one at Ghirardelli Square.  The sundaes are the best and the prices are reasonable.  Today's visit had even better service than usual.  We were greeted by someone at the door with samples and when there weren't enough seats for an extra guest an employee offered to get us one.  Great service, great food.  :)
author: Tony K.

description: The place was super clean, everything was organize and the staff was friendly and helpful. It was somewhat pricey but it was worth it since it's a name brand chocolate. I found a coupon on yelp. Downloaded it and print it out. The coupon really works. It made be a hassle to download it but it worth it because everything is really pricey. I would come back to buy chocolate for  special occasion.
author: Chris Y.

description: My daughter ate butterscotch icecream and I chose banana split icecream: Both were okay. Butterscotch was too sweet: Very lacking in flavor. Banana split was okay. Portion was huge: I shared it with my husband. I wish the ice cream was more flavorful than it was. Be aware of the long line that you need to endure. If you are in the area, it may be a good idea to nap at the Ghirardelli square, which is a unique experience!
author: Ana T.

description: Awesome place to check out to splurge on a ton of sugar (definitely worthy of a cheat meal!).
author: Juan A.

description: Such a cute little spot. The shopping center is full of festivity during the holidays. It's a great date spot of place to go with the family. Service here is wonderful and the ice cream is delicious!
author: Laila W.

description: The best cost/benefit at the store is the golden box. If you arrange the chocolates like I did in the picture, you can take home 18 squares and 13 minis for $12,50 plus, of course, the very nice gift box :-)
author: Andre D.

description: The stairs up to this place are a killer. But if you need a workout before gorging yourself on ice cream and chocolate, then you're in the right place! Way too overpriced, you're paying for the brand name. The greeter at the door gives out little chocolate samples which was nice, though. Also, the floors are bowing which is a little scary. They might cave in someday!
author: Tiffany M.

description: This is a nice, new place in the Palace Hotel in what had been a clothing store.  It is attractive and the staff friendly.  They have ice cream, cocoa, and they sell Ghirardelli chocolate (mostly the small individually wrapped squares), all of which is nice to have available.  They hand out squares sometimes and it is nice to be able to buy individual ones to try different flavours or mix and match.  That said, the ice cream items and hot chocolate seem to be a bit crudely prepared with a heavy hand and very, very sweet with little flavour otherwise.  I haven't tried the special hot chocolate that one mixes onesself, though, and that could be better.
author: Wulfstan C.

description: It's an iconic must for anyone visiting San Francisco from out of town or just across town. Is there better icecream? Sure, but it doesn't come with the view of the bay and the feeling of SF. The sundaes only come in one size: huge (expensive). Make it a meal or share with someone. They have a lot of chocolates for sale. This is not the best deal. You can get their chocolates anywhere for much cheaper.  However, take home a bottle of their caramel sauce; it's amazing.  Make sure you take advantage of the chocolate samples they hand out as you enter. They're handy for when you need a reminder of that sweet trip you had.
author: Ashley B.

description: It's good and definitely a nice experience. I got the strawberry fudge sundae and at $10+ it's nothing that amazing.
author: Jenn R.

description: great shakes! Enjoyed a to go order. The store needed a little TCL and cleanliness, but it was also closing time. Friendly staff. Cool names like Lakeya...
author: Matt B.

description: Excellent place to have a chocolate flavored products. Only thing is long wait in queue
author: Satinder S.

description: The place is pretty clean, the staff was friendly, and the price was expected.  They offered us free samples of chocolate while we waited in line, which was nice.  My girlfriend and I had the "Treasure Island," which was really tasty and satisfied our sweet tooth.  Overall a pretty good experience.
author: Ryan W.

description: Kind of expensive due to the nature of place - it being so touristy and it's Ghirardelli. After a little wait in the line, I ordered my banana split. It was so crowded that it felt so impossible to find seating at this place but we managed to grab a table. My order came pretty quickly and enjoyed it immensely!!!
author: Hiromi I.

description: I was so disappointed! We had the famous hot fudge ice cream Sundae . The place was packed and we waited a really long time so I expected awesome hot fudge on my Sundae. This was not the case! I make better chocolate sauce at home! The hot fudge was thin, there was barely any there and it wasn't even warm. I am surprised this place gets so many great reviews. I don't mind waiting for great food but to wait all that time for a mediocre Sundae...totally not worth it.
author: T D.

description:
i took my date to a place where it's predominately known for it's ice cream/ milkshakes/sundaes. 

she opted for the hot chocolate. THISSSSS chick. same thing happened for that one time we went to a pho joint and instead of getting the typical beef/ combo meat pho, she opted for CHICKEN pho. who da heil orders a chicken pho?! what da heillll ?!  then again, to be fair, i guess why the heilll was it on the menu to begin with, right?! hahahaha 

w/e i can't complain, it was pretty good, it was cold that night sooo i guess she had a point. 

note for dudes: there's this area behind the store where yall can go strolling or bench sitting afterwards. great scenery. chicks love great sceneries.
author: Thankie S.

description: The sundaes were okay but nothing special and really expensive. One scoop with hot fudge $5.50 okay since we are on vacation but I would be surprised if locals ever ate here.
author: Kathy D.

description: Large shop with all the candy and cable car candies you could imagine. The huge sundae was great for 4 of us to share. A bit over priced though we figured it would be due to it being a tourist destination.
author: monya b.

description: I got a flavor full butter pecan sugar cone for $4 I said single scoop because it's cheaper but the man hooked it up with two scoops. My mom got a single scoop mango sorbet and that was too sweet even for me but I enjoyed it. My brother got a nob hill chill for $10 so watch out every 16oz drink is $10. Long lines and usually one guy doing everything by himself. It is worth it here.
author: Sovenne O.

description: I live in SoMa and went in to buy several boxes of chocolates for gifts for an overseas trip. As I was peeling off the price I noticed that a few of the boxes were past the expiry date! I called Ghiradelli and was told that the manager would call back but he didn't so I ended up going back into the store - the manager then proceeded to tell me the expiry is just a recommended date and that they are still fine!! Shame on you Ghiradelli for trying to sell expired chocolates! Especially for full price! Disgusting behavior!
author: Michelle S.

description: It is a nice place. not for me, though. Line is way too long and I can buy their chocolates in CVS for cheeper
author: Anya V.

description:
total tourist trap, but the ice cream is delicious and totally worth the wait and the calories.  and the servings are HUUUUUUUUUUUUGE.
and you can get the special ghiradelli seasonal flavors too!
author: Liz C.

description: Holy cow this is super sweet!! honestly though, what you expect??? Family was visiting from el monte, and being touristy, they wanted to go in ghirardelli. Almost everytjing here has caramel sauce or chocolate sauce yuck. Banana split was good, but too much sweet. My  shake was also very good. The light brown sauce is apparently was salted caramel....the people were really friendly and there's free sample in the shop. I only gave it 2 stars because it's way too sweet for me. It's a dream come true for people who want diabetes or someone with a sweet tooth. Waaaay too sweet and it took awhile for our orders to come. Try out the giagantic banana split.
author: Evelyn L.

description: Wasn't what I thought. A tourist trap for sure. What was pleasant was we order a fudge sundae and a banana split and neither was too sweet at all. In fact lacked a little sugar and I was OK with that.
author: Kks78 S.

description: Delicious ice cream, lots of seating and is open late in the evenings! This is the perfect spot to go with friends after dinner in the city
author: Mel P.

description: I'm sure there are better ice cream places but this is one is a great tourist trap that's worth a try. The waffle cones and banana splits were excellent.
author: Malachi S.

description:
My best friend and I have been here at least three times around 9pm after class. Even though they close at 10, they always let us order a sundae. Their service is very fast, and their sundaes are to die for! If you have a huge sweet tooth and don't mind paying 9 dollars for a sundae, this is the perfect place for you. One sundae was perfect to share between the two of us. 

We've tried the Haight AshBerry, the Cable Car, and the World Famous. All three were 5 stars in my eyes.
author: Christel L.

description: I had the best chocolate chip milk shake that I could ever dream of!! This place ROCKS!!! Oh and not to forget that my co-worker also had a cookies and cream milk shake. We could barely drink them, the milk shakes were soooooo thick and yummy...and today was a great day to have one.
author: Mae D.

description: I can't believe after 15 years of living in the city.. I finally took my visiting parents to eat here! It is a very cute square with fountains and lights at night. A hop and skip away from Pier 39 it is a great place to visit during the day or at night. They have plenty of shakes and desserts to choose from. It can get a little crowded but who doesn't love to people watch?
author: Yennie N.

description: The ice cream is a whole other breed here! All of the toppings are top notch! we had the butterscotch sundae and classic fudge sundae with a waffle bowl. It is a little spendy, but you're absolutely paying for the name.
author: Chandra M.

description: 30 minute wait for a $10 hot fudge sundae. This place gets by on its reputation as a tourist destination not quality or value.
author: Lynne S.

description: Great location!! A little expensive probably but portions are meant for sharing.
author: Joy D.

description: very expensive for ice cream and chocolate. the ice cream is straight out of eddys grand ice cream bucket you can get in the supermarket. if this was not a tourist attraction i definitely would not recommend going.
author: Warren L.

description: I have gone to the location in Ghirardelli Square and had an awesome experience. However when I walked into this place I immediately smelled the dirty rags that are used to wipe the tables and counters. The service was excellent as was the sundae, but I couldn't get over the smell! I wish I asked for the sundae to go. Also, the spoons that came with the sundae were sticky. Everything needs a good scrub down!
author: Melissa S.

description: I used to like this corner chocolate gift shop. But the service is growing worse and worse. I ordered an iced coffee but received a hot one in a 85 degree day. I used to have yummy hot chocolate almost twice a week in this shop. Sadly, they don't do semi/sweet. And this is fine, I can accept intake extra sugar, but the service is really disappointed nowadays. Hopefully it will get better.
author: Lisa C.

description: Ice cream was delicious!!! went there with my daughter, she loved the place and of course the ice cream. The parking could be better but what can you say its SF. but over all the place was nice, great customer service.
author: Hamed A.

description: You're definitely paying for the name. Got a huge brownie sundae for $11 after tax, and it definitely filled my sweet tooth craving but wasn't as amazing in taste as I anticipated. Convenient location. But I'd definitely rather go a little more out of my way to get a more memorable cone.
author: Mina C.

description: Great location by the pier and the chocolate is always so rich and delicious!! The service is good and the desserts came out in about 5 minutes.
author: Deanna L.

description: Can't go wrong with ghirardelli chocolate or ice cream!
author: Elizabeth P.

description: We went here tonight and had a fantastic experience! I've been here twice before but not for a long time. Our group got the salted caramel sundae, brownie sundae and frozen hot chocolate with ice cream. All delicious! The frozen hot chocolate was kinda wam when it came then became room temp, so I wouldn't really recommend it. Regular hot chocolate is great though! All of the workers were very friendly and helpful!! Catherine brought us our desserts and she was great! I asked the guys at the sundae to go bar to heat up my "frozen" chocolate and they gladly helped me out!
author: Lindsay B.

description: Treasure Island sundae hit the spot. Very rich and a free chocolate sample as we walked in the door.
author: Adam R.

description:
I was so excited to have a hot chocolate date with my son today at Ghiradelli's. Service was prompt but the Hot Chocolate was disappointing and we left after a few sips. The drinks were cold, and I should have picked out the cream, because it just became worse.  The cream was sticky and not fluffy.  

Worse hot chocolate I ever had.
author: Marianne G.

description: Came in at 9pm expecting a shit show.  Surprisingly not that busy, I was greeted immediately and handed a mini chocolate while listening to the special.  Ordered and almost had my sundae before sitting down.  Experience made 5 stars thanks to exceptional service
author: Shawn B.

description: Stayed @ Palace hotel and this was connected to it. Staff was nice and there was a nice big selection. Right out of the Bart station + no line! yay
author: Tiff W.

description:
Pricey but delicious. Really enjoyed their dark chocolate fudge on my sundae but didn't care for the brownie which is odd because we always buy their day brownie mix at home.
I was also expecting a better ambience given that it is a tourist attraction.
author: Rosemary T.

description: Ask for light fudge if your item has fudge in it. They use way too much fudge IMO otherwise it's good.
author: Daniel C.

description: The ice cream itself is pretty run of the mill, but the hot fudge that goes on it is what makes it all worth it. There are a few downsides though. For one, desserts here are pretty pricey. Also, they tend to forget to make the requested substitutions (although this aspect has gotten better since they got rid of that one cranky woman that used to work there). Lastly, it seems like the size of the brownie in the brownie sundae has gotten smaller, which is a shame for my taste buds but perhaps a blessing to my waistline. xP
author: G C.

description: Love this place! My friend and I decided to stop in for some hot coco before heading home down to the South Bay. What a treat that everyone was still in a good mood and super friendly (even nearing 10pm when most folks working in the city get crabby). Carl in particular was an absolute dear. Great environment, we'll definitely try to stop by whenever we go back to the city. :)
author: Jen N.

description: I enjoyed being here with my family during Thanksgiving week. However, it was really crowded as always. The line was so long. Secondly, there was no room to sit indoors because all the chairs and tables were taken. But I think that just says how popular this place really is. I thought the location was ideal for anyone wanting to get into the San Francisco vibe. It's a few blocks away from the pier area, which also provides a great view of the newly modified Bay Bridge. Absolutely stunning! I've seen and drove through that bridge for a good chunk of my life and it surely has come a long way. I think it's best to walk and/or take public transportation considering the sky high garage rates and street parking being limited. Furthermore, I think WI-Fi as an addition would be a complimentary service for guests.
author: Rachel P.

description: Had the Cable Car. Amazing stuff. Chocolate ice cream with little marshmallows in it. Was not too expensive, and it was more than enough for two. Definitely recommend.
author: Rohit M.

description: good dark chocolates bars. hot chocolate is very very sweet and bland. probably very similar to the quality you could get at mcdonalds. extremely disappointing for a "world class" chocolatier specially  5.25 per cut.
author: Jonathan F.

description: Update on an update - FINALLY got a response from Ghirardelli Corporate Offices, albeit late, it still came and was genuinely corrective in nature.  Many apologies to my original difficulties, that's not how our Corporate culture works, etc., but they backed it up with some gift certificates and a rather nice chocolate treat basket delivered to my front door.  They didn't have to do that......but they did, and it is only right that I acknowledge them for it.  Haven't had the chance to make use of the gift certificate yet (although it's on the radar), and we happily devoured the nice gift basket, so thank you Ghirardelli in recognizing a service misstep and you took action to compensate a customer on a whole lot of inconvenience - nice job.
author: Kevin C.

description: The main store in Ghirardelli Square is better. The waffle cone tasted like very watered down batter (which it was; we saw the pitcher of batter later). Ice cream was fine.
author: Susan Z.

description: Amazing.   Hands down, the best damn hot fudge Sundae in town.  Very happy they opened a downtown location.  Staff is very polite.  The chocolate toppings for the sundaes are phenomenal.
author: Sunny J.

description: Yummy yum yum hot chocolate , a short stop on my way to work.  Yes, a little pricey but it makes me happy!
author: Pam S.

description: Always a must stop for our family.  It is always high quality and we can share a couple of sundaes for our family of four.
author: Sean W.

description: Some of the grumpiest people - the 2 girls behind the ice cream counter - work here. When manager was notified, she didn't quite seem to care. Henry and the door guy were the only nice guy working there. Only redeeming fact were the ice-cream and chocolates.
author: Kevin T.

description: Simple chocolate sundae cost $7.05 ans was worth every penny.
author: Roger H.

description: omg what a nice cap to the evening. we had a nice, romantic dessert together at this fine chocolate and ice cream bar. fantastic!
author: Frank G.

description: We were met at the door with a smile and a signature chocolate square - sheer bliss!  Then we were left to browse in the huge chocolate store and after a time, the attendant approached and asked if we had any questions about the menu - yes, lots!!  We ordered to-die-for sundaes, wonderfully warmed brownies and tall, very tall, lattes that didn't leave us wishing we'd ordered a double shot.  Everything tasted other worldly, the chocolate everything is really without equal (which I can say because I live in Australia ...)  Definitely a highlight of our holiday in the States and a great first day exploration in the great city of San Francisco.  If you want a really first class chocolate hit don't go anywhere else, come to Ghirardelli's!
author: Marama G.

description: A strange thing happened at the Ghiradelli store on New Montgomery.  The chocolate was great, of course.  It's Ghiradelli!!   I went there to purchase three $20.00 packs of chocolate.  In the store, there are cellophane bags which are used to personalize individual chocolate.  I took five of the bags so I could divide my three large $20.00 bags.  When I went to the counter, I ask the clerk if I could have the five cellophane bags or pay for it.  The manager was there and he instructed the clerk take back two of the bags, stating "you're only allow three for free".  I was taken back since the cellophane can't be worth more than $0.01 each.  Regardless, I offered to pay for it.  I think Ghiradellii needs to have better training of their managers to make sound business judgment.   Otherwise, the place is great place to buy chocolate.
author: H S.

description: I gotta say, their chocolate chip cookies surprise me in a good way. When I'm looking for a cookie with a soft chewy, almost raw cookie dough center, Ghirardelli's is my go-to.
author: Aiko S.

description: I stumbled into this store the first time when I was staying at the adjacent Palace Hotel on the day after they opened.  I forgave some of their missteps because the place was brand new.  However, we recently visited again - about 6 months after opening - and this place still seems a bit befuddling.  We place orders for sundaes and were told they would have to served for us "to go" because they were out of the glass sundae dishes.  Somehow I found this hard to believe since there were dozens and dozens of them lined up behind the counter.  Whatever.  So we got our sundaes and sat down to a couple sticky tables and a stick floor.  I guess they don't wipe/mop around here very often.  Of course, the sundae was fine, but nothing out of the ordinary.  I don't get the whole concept of the retail store either.  It's all Ghiradelli squares of one variety or another packaged about 50 different ways.  Why would you buy the stuff here when you can get it in nearly every grocery store in America?  This place better find a differentiating reason to exist or else it will hit the skids....fast.
author: Ryan W.

description: You can never go wrong with Ghirardelli. I had the regular fudge sundae and it was amazing. I also tried the new cookies and cream chocolate square and I want more. Nice place to hang out and get your chocolate fix. Service was fast. the place has a few small tables but lots of counter space. I plan to be back soon.
author: Annie W.

description: I had the best dark chocolate milkshake here. Also the staff was super friendly. I definitely get the feeling that they are catering to tourists here as the friendly staff reminded me of the kind of reception I get at Disneyland which is something I can get used to!
author: Caroline G.
